Do not do the homework for the class it is a waste of energy. If anything REWATCH THE LECTURE VIDEOS over and over Do the practice tests and redo the quizzes.

Marc is a great professor and is very caring/ enthusiastic. He has a-lot of responsibility within the business school, but tutoring sessions are very accessible and helpful. His class is difficult, but more because the content is hard. To do well in this class, you must keep up with the content provided and watch his weekly lecture videos .

Marc is truly a legend, and one of the best professors in the business department at OSU. His lectures are well put together and easy to follow. He gives a ton of practice problems which helps those that can only learn from practice. The only negative is the three exams are worth 80% of your grade, so it is very important to do well on the exams.
Worst class Ive ever taken. Severely damaged my mental health and made me the most stressed Ive ever felt. Ive always done good in school and this class really hurt my confidence.
Good at teaching but horrid at writing exams.

This class can be considered difficult by some, but I found if you watch the weekly lecture videos and attend your recitation, and take the provided practice exam before each exam an A in this class is very achievable.
Hi everyone, welcome back. Betty Derose, ABC, XYZ company

People will tell you horror stories about this class but honestly, if you do the work he requires on an efficient timeline, it is not bad at all. Marc is a great lecturer and is very clear and organized in providing class criteria and due dates well ahead of time. I never had any trouble in either accounting class, it is all about time management.
I've heard horror stories about this class and don't get me wrong, it's not a cakewalk. However, if you put in the time, watch every lecture, and do the practice problems, it is definitely doable.

Marc is a great professor! He does a fantastic job at explaining tough concepts! The class is well organized and if you watch the online modules, go to lecture & recitation, and practice with the homework- you'll be fine! I found that his exams were really easy if I just made a Quizlet with the vocab terms & redid old practice problems to study.

He is a very good professor, much better than some of the bad professors at osu. People say that the intro to accounting 2200 class is incredibly hard, it is not. If you just take an hour out of your day and put his lectures on 2x speed you can then go to his "review class/lecture" with at least some knowledge.

Very difficult for an intro class. He teaches both required accounting classes for all business students, so if you want a business degree there's no other option. Does explain everything, but is very boring and his teaching style is very difficult. Watch lectures on your own time, and only go to class to work on practice problems

Of what I’ve taken so far at Fisher, Professor Smith’s courses are the most organized by far. However, 90% of the weight is on 3 exams, all of which are extremely difficult. Do the non-mandatory homework, do the lecture problems, and then gauge your skills with the practice exam. It’s awful but you will become stronger as a student.

As an introduction to accounting, this class is very difficult. Marc Smith is extremely boring to listen to. He is very serious the whole time in lecture and takes his accounting extremely seriously, even for an intro level class. I believe his content is too strong for new comers and scares them away from accounting.
He is very hard, study hard
Good professor if you do the work

Marc is a great professor, however, the exams are a bit difficult. Do your best to do the homework's, they aren't for a grade but you will be better for doing them. It is a weed-out class, so just don't get weeded out.

I do not care what anyone says. this guy is the best teacher at OSU. His class is difficult but if you do everything he gives you then you will get a good grade. Most I have ever learned in one class.
Marc smith does not care so you better if you want to pass.

Marc is a great professor. His class is well organized, and he is very easy to communicate with. However, the course is graded by very few quizzes and tests, so I found it difficult to do well. No matter how hard I worked in the class, I could not comprehend accounting. Thankfully, he showed grace and curved our final grades.

The class itself is very difficult and time consuming, marc does an amazing job of explaining and getting students to think. He offers practice exams that were very similar to the exam but the 3 exams are worth a lot of your grade almost 80%. If you pay attention, DO THE HOMEWORK, and double check your quiz work with classmates you will be fine.

Marc Smith maintains the gold standard of teaching accounting basics. Sets clear expectations for exams and quizzes. TA's are very helpful and recommended if you are struggling with the more math intensive parts of the class. There are in-person exams at night that are mostly multiple choice.

Look, I'll give it you straight. Accounting is not a breeze. But if you put in the work, you'll be fine. Marc Smith explains and walks through things THE BEST out of any professors I've had. Pay close attention to the online lectures, and do the lecture problems WITH him. If you can do the HW problems on your own, you will get an A on the exam.

Marc Smith is by far the best professor I have had at Ohio State. Although his class consists of a lot of work, it is not as much as some other business core classes require. He takes a lot of time to go over very clear explanations about how to do problems. He gives you everything you need to succeed and I like his class structure a lot!

Marc is the most organized professor Ive had at Ohio State. The class is difficult but all the materials are given to you and if you do all of the ungraded homeworks there arent any surprises. He gives hints about exams which I wish I paid more attention to earlier. Exams are very difficult but if you study like he tells you to youll do fine

Marc is one of the best professors in Fisher. Accounting 1 and 2 aren't supposed to be easy but his structured material and good explanations help a lot in succeeding in the class. Do ALL the work and practice problems that he gives and it will help so much on the exams.
Watching lecture videos and recitation recordings helped a lot more than doing homework/practice problems. Good professor, just a very difficult class as it's a weed out class in Fisher.

I know many dont like Marc, but hes not asking for much. Do everything he provides and you will pass this class. He may expect a lot out of people to be prepared for class, but thats not too much to ask. Everyone wants to take the easy route and try to give half effort, and that just wont work. Easily the most organized class and professor ever

There are very few grades and the exams are worth almost the whole grade. The questions on exams are worth a lot of points each with no partial credit. You really have to pay attention and study and do the optional homeworks to know whats going on. And dont forget your calculator for exams.

Take a step into a time machine before quickbooks existed and you would need to manually resolve the most intricate accounting issues without any formula assistance. The level of difficulty is completely disproportionate to the fact that nobody will ever need to know this material in the real world.
Class is impossible, but Marc Smith cares about students and cares about teaching
Marc is really good at teaching accounting. He is the best accounting teacher I have ever met. Hope my acctmis2300 marc can be much better.

One of the worst courses I've had to take. Exams are worth about 75% of your final grade, and they're structured in a way such that missing just a few questions will absolutely destroy your grade. Makes you memorize insane formulas (some questions require the use of 9+ unique ones you need to have memorized). No partial credit.
No partial credit on quizzes or exams. (Some questions are up to 9 points each) Homework not graded Only 10 grades total: 1 syllabus quiz, 6 quizzes and 3 exams

The lectures and practice don't give a clear picture of what you need to know. You pay attention in lecture and everything seems to make sense, then when you get to the quiz or test you feel like you didn't learn what you needed to learn in order to pass.

Marc is nothing short of a hardass. He never makes grading exceptions, his exams are incredibly difficult, and in many ways is a rite of passage for business students. However, he has by far the best designed online course I have ever taken and he does a fantastic job of explaining the material.

In my 4 years at Ohio State I dont believe I have faced a more difficult class. Ive aced every other course ive taken in Fisher, literally every other course. Marc really isnt a bad guy, but he IS a bad professor. If you want to spend the semester crying over a class, sure take it, if not do yourself a favor and take accounting at C-State.
One of the best professors here in Fisher

Marc Smith is a great professor. He teaches the material well. If your like me and do not pick up material super easily, you will need to do lots of practice problems each week to stay on schedule. There were 4 exams and 4 quizes making up your grade. Exams were very diffucult. 10 questions worth 50-65 points each. Study a lot.

Marc Smith does not care about your grade. You will learn greatly from his lectures, however, they do not cover NEARLY enough detail needed. If this was the only class you had to take for the semester? You're in luck then, because he expects you to spend 30 hours a week on his material. Felt he was not looking out for the student either.
Professor Smith is great at explaining the material. You have to do all the practice problems in order to succeed in this class. Repetition is key! However, his final exam was very hard!

His videos were very helpful and he made it easy to understand the concepts. However, a lot of the material was difficult to understand. I thought the final in this class was very difficult, but I think if you spend a lot of time in this class you can succeed.

If you are willing to work, you will do well in this class. I got a D on the first test with preparation of watching all of the lecture videos, Tuesday recitations, and completing the study guide. Wanting to do better, I decided to do every problem in the module prior to the test and now have an A in the class. If you want to do well just work hard

Very harsh when grading exams. Also makes you take exams on Fridays at 6:30pm. What professor does this?? Worst possible time to take an exam. This was the toughest college course Ive ever taken, do not recommend.

I've heard some crazy things about Marc, but from what I have seen, he is a good guy. He always helped me whenever I needed it. Got the material across clearly. He is a very organized guy. You have to study in order to pass this class! There is no faking this stuff. It is easy math but you gotta know which numbers to use.

Marc Smith was truly a solid professor, but with that being said avoid at all costs. His exams are absolutely brutal for absolutely no reason. What his lectures and homework problems show are nothing nearly as challenging as the exam. So overall, you will truly learn a lot, but your final grade will not show it at all.

This class is tough and mistakes will take a large toll on your final grade. In order to do good in his class, you must do all the lecture, recitation, and homework problems to learn from the little tricks that Marc might throw on you in the exams. Learn from your mistakes before taking the exam. This class is well organized. Good luck!
Expects you to not have a life. Videos are long and so old. If you don't have a life then getting a decent grade will be easy.
If you give his classes a good effort then it is not difficult to get an A. He is a great professor who is very passionate about accounting and explains it as clearly as he possibly could.

Marc is probably the best teacher Ive ever had. He gives you all of the material and practice problems you need to prepare you for exams and never tries to purposefully trick you. If you watch and take notes on his pre-recorded lectures videos, you can get an easy A. Do the practice problems to study and you'll see everything you need to pass exams
Very hard class and not a great professor. Tests he gives are very difficult.

Grades aside, If you have the option to be in-person, do it. His videos for lectures are old and easy to get distracted from. They changed how they did quizzes this semester, and for the better. The exams on the other hand are still extremely hard and time consuming. I used up the entire time on every exam.

Marc Smith is a great professor. He actually teaches the material very well and goes very in-depth. However, you need to put the time in to watch his modules and attend his lectures. If you do this, take good notes, and study for the exams, you will do pretty well. I know he has few grades, but he also curves the course at the end usually.

Marc Smith is challenging. But he does give you a lot of information to use. The recitations are a lifesaver as well as the extra homework. Make sure you know all of the topics. There are only 8 things that get graded throughout the entire semester. Study a lot before the tests and make an equation sheet. This was a literal lifesaver.

The class is difficult and requires a lot of work but it is a class that makes OSU distinguished from other universities. No other intro accounting class is this in-depth and tough, but if you put the work in to learn what Marc puts into his award-winning online lectures, you'll feel a lot more accomplished leaving the class than you did coming in.

I took online class with him and here are some honest feedbacks. He only had quizzes and tests. Definitely go to recitations or go through the recordings if you take it online. His problems were exactly the same as he talked about in the recitations. Go throgh all of them, and you'll be fine.

Does not give enough chances for students to improve. Videos are reused every year for like 5+ years. Does not give realistic practice exam questions for students or worksheets. Not enough time to take exam.

Marc Smith is a good guy and a good professor, but only having 7 grades for the whole semester leaves absolutely 0 room for students to have any error if they're trying to get an A. Exams tend to be a little tougher than the quizzes and lectures. Mess up one big exam and you're sort of screwed for the rest of the semester.

BEWARE!!! The exams are excessively hard for no reason and the class averages are always below a 70%. Of course there are outliers that will get As but the majority of the class will do poorly. Overall terrible professor and just your typical weed out class.

Class is structured in a organized manner with modules covering each week. If the material doesn't click with you there are office hours and TA work sessions where you can easily learn to understand the material. In addition, you'll receive emails a week before the exam if you get sidetracked and haven't went through lectures for the previous week.
The most organized class I've ever taken. Marc takes a dump on the organization of all these other online classes. No partial credit is a b word, but show up and do the work and you will be fine.
Professor Smith is excellent. He is very clear about what is going to be on exams. The class itself is boring, but he makes it easy. If you take decent notes in lecture youll pass.
Class is organized. But you cannot watch lectures at 1.5x. Overall an easy class.
god awful terrible. Purposely makes the problems hard

I just took ACCTMIS 2200 with Marc Smith and he is not what people say he is. His class is well organized and I believe he truly understands how to explain accounting to people who don't understand. His quizzes/exams are purely based on his lectures and practice problems, which makes it easy to study for. Go to class and master the content for an A

Marc is a good professor in my opinion. He explains things very well and gives you everything you need to succeed in the class. Since it's online there is no partial credit so if you make a small mistake you miss the whole problem. Exams are only 10 questions so you're already at a B if you miss one problem. Good thing is everything is open note.

No partial credit on assignments and exams makes for a painful experience if you make small mistakes here and there. I would describe myself as a good student and the topics in this course are not particularly hard, which makes my grade result even more frustrating. Its unfortunate that this guy is the only professor available for accounting.

It's accounting with Marc Smith, yes it's a tough class. That said, if you prioritize it (which you should), a good grade is possible. What I did: watched the module videos Thursday and Friday, enjoy the weekend, do the practice problems Monday, attend recitation Tuesday, do the problem assignment Wednesday. Stay organized. Be confident. You got it

Not a bad professor, just a challenging class. Was much easier during COVID semesters because exams were open note. Marc isn't super helpful outside of class, but tells you almost exactly what you need to do to succeed in his class. Lot of work required to do well but not impossible.

I really enjoyed this class. He is very knowledgeable and I learned so much in this class. If you want to do well you have to do all the assignments, quizzes, and problem assignments. Go to office hours, go to the accounting tutor room. The resources are there for you to do well. Also attend recitation.

Accounting is difficult but Marc does not try to trick you on quizzes or exams. They're all open note and his lectures and recitation problems prepare you well. All lectures can be done on your own time which is really convenient!!

A lot of people really dont like him cuz his tests are hard and hes very particular but he genuinely gives you everything you need to succeed. Yes the class is hard and you have to study a lot but his class is so organized and if you really pay attention and take good notes you can get a good grade. Gonna miss him
Uncaring career academic with little real world experience. Enjoys watching students struggle to meet his criteria.

Marc Smith is undeniably the worst professor at The Ohio State University. Not accommodating whatsoever even during a global pandemic he simply has no care for his students. Class is organized, but I would stay away from him on all costs. Take any accounting classes at any other university other than at The Ohio State University with him.

this professor is one of the worst at osu. going back i'd take this course somewhere else. do yourself a favor, dont study your just wasting your time, no matter how much you put in you wont get anything out. class is so hard instructor had to add a curve at the end.
test are near impossible professor is very bad and unkind. These reviews are not all written y students beware
Good guy and easy to understand. Sets clear expectations and provides resources for you to be successful. However you do have to study and do the work for an A.

Marc loves to throw curveballs good luck studying for these exams because it is impossible. Marc says that the class takes work, and that is true except if you do a reasonable amount of work you will probably still fail. This professor is not willing to work with you on most issues, he is quite rude. I would recommend avoiding at all costs.

I think he gets a bad rep amongst those who do poorly because they don't understand the amount of effort it takes to get a good grade for a class like accounting. Yeah, it's more difficult than your average business class, but it's not hard enough to point to be labeled unfair. Put in the effort and you'll succeed.

This professor prides himself on making this course exceptionally difficult. If you struggle with complicated algebra (i.e simultaneous equations & substitution) I recommend taking this course at another university. Each question is word problem format and has 3 to 5 fluctuating variables. Professor is not flexible whatsoever. Tests hard (60 avg)

I took Acct4500 virtual during Summer. The class was not a breeze. I was not able to attend the Live session, so watched the recorded version of it & took heavy notes. 3 Quizzes,3Exams. M/C and Short essay questions. I did better on short essay questions. Class is CPA level difficult, something Marc is known for. But the effort pays off.

Teaching wasn't bad. Very clearn when you ask questions. Exams were so difficult though. You better have a CPA book to keep up, and expect the exam multiple choice questions to be harder than the CPA itself. I only recommend if you're willing to put in a ton of extra effort just to pass.

Marc runs a tight ship, but he is very knowledgeable and respected. Always come to lecture prepared since he cold-calls often. Do the practice exams and practice problems at least twice to prepare for the exams. The class felt a bit 'old school' with the outdated lecture videos and test-taking protocol, but I learned a lot. Welcome back! Lol.

Marc is the best professor I ever had. Im an international student and Im still learning English, but it is so easy to understand his classes because he always uses the most simple words. Every time he explains the problems he makes them seem really easy to solve. Patience, dedication and his passion for teaching are his strongest points.

2200 and 2300 with Marc are hard but fair. A good grade in this class is certainly possible but the time commitment is heavy, be sure to remember that during scheduling. Be sure to study all the material provided because it probably will all be fair game on the exam.

I wish every class was ran the way that Marc runs Accounting 1 and 2. Watch the lecture videos, go to lecture, and rework the homework problems a couple times each without your notes and you'll be fine if you're a competent student

Marc's classes are highly organized. You can always know what you should do to boost your grades. He gives lots of exercises like homework and practice exams. If you really work on these stuffs, you'll find it easy to deal with exam. The thing is if you make a mistake on a problem, your point will be largely taken off. Be careful on calculations.

Marc is one of the best profs out there. He's fair, incredibly organized, and is very clear what he expects from his students. You definitely have to work for the grade! He is an amazing lecturer and he has my respect. Marc has high expectations, but that does not make him a bad prof. He's challenging in the best way possible. We need more like him

Challenging class but he gives you all the materials to do well as long as you watch the online lecture videos and show up to lecture and problem session class. Best way to study for exams is to do the optional homework and practice exam. Very passionate about the material and good professor.

Hyperactive prof that knows his stuff. Best way to do well on the exams: write out lecture notes, do practice exams, and do practice and recitation problems because recitation problems are really helpful when he wants to add a twist to even the simplest questions.
Mean >:(

Marc Smith is one of the most well-known professors in Fisher. His classes are very challenging but he gives all the materials you need to succeed. Rewatch all the modules right before the exam, write down importance formulas, and go over the problems he gives in class. I honestly loved the class.

There is a lot of information in this class, which makes the exams pretty hard. The carmen quizzes are easy because you can use your notes. If you take good notes and study A LOT for the exams - study EVERYTHING - you might be able to get an A. I can't emphasize enough that you literally need to know EVERYTHING before the exams.
The class is only graded off of the quizzes and exams. Because of it only being available with online lectures, I found it very hard to be able to fully understand the material.

Marc is an interesting fella. He is very talented and passionate in teaching accounting. I really felt like he set the class up well in terms for students to learn material well. You will pick up on his pick up lines and then laugh when he uses them. You will have to work for an A but it is very possible.

Marc Smith is a great professor. He teaches the lecture content in a clear and understandable way. His exams are extremely hard - you MUST study and do all of the practice problems and quizzes that he provides. Be okay with not getting an A.

Nice guy, sure, but not a good prof at all. His exams are impossible and worth soooo much. I went to office hours and the tutoring room and did everything I could to understand the material but it still didn't help me do well on his exams. Taking this class at a community college now.

The class is very straightforward. Everything I have learned so far I haven't forgotten. Exams are made to be difficult, but it was honestly quite easy, just make sure to do the HW problems, go to recitation, and watch the lecture videos throughly. No idea why people are having a hard time with this course.

I honestly dont know why he has such a good rating. Marc is an awful teacher. You are required to memorize every little detail in his modules and if you dont then youre SOL on his exams. I think Id like him more if we could use our notes BECAUSE THERES SO MUCH MATERIAL. But we cant. So good luck

Marc is fair. He is very clear about what to expect each week. Watch the online lectures, take notes, do the homeworks, go to recitation and you should be fine. Don't procrastinate and leave all the material to study in the exam week, that just won't work at all. The exams are fair, so do the practice problems before the exams.

Had Marc for 2200 and 2300. His overall teaching style is well-talked-about on here, so I'll share my secret for doing well in his class: study IN-DEPTH. Simply going over the material and doing the practice isn't enough. You have to know why each concept works the way it does. If you can figure that out, you'll do well. Marc is a good man/prof.
Do the optional homework and re watch the videos as much as possible. Have to put in so much time and effort to do well in this class. Possible, but too much of a commitment. Exams are hard.

He did not provide any homework for practice, so sometimes you knew the concepts but didnt know how to do it. Exams are pretty hard , I got 244 out of 270 for only 2 mistakes (I lost 22 points for a single concept I familiar with. I think that is too much for only one aspect of a concept). Avoid him if you need enough practices for exam.

If you have no basic understanding of accounting, you need to show up to every class! If you skip, you'll fall behind. Do the optional homework. Practice is key. Make sure to do well on the take home quizzes because the exams are difficult. Most people will pass with the nice curve that is given, but most will end up with Cs.

Whether you like him or not, he is a great lecturer. YOU MUST watch all of the modules before the class and dedicate most of your time on videos. Make sure to watch them even if you don't go to the class. There is no partial credit for exam problems including those are not MCQ. You have to be extremely cautious when drawing an answer.

Marc is a great professor and I would absolutely recommend him to anyone. This class is difficult and you need to watch all the videos and attend lecture and recitation to do well but Marc does everything he can to give you all the resources you need to succeed. If you study hard and pay attention, this class should be no problem.

If you don't do well in this class it is no one's fault but your own. Marc is easily the best teaching professor in fisher. His exams are hard but doable if you watch the videos and attend lecture. He gives you everything you need to get an A in the course and is always available to students, also a great guy.

Excellent professor. People that don't do well in his classes probably shouldn't be in the business school. The exams are very difficult, but it is totally possible to do well on them if you put the time in.

Not bad as people make him out to be. His lectures & recitations are very straightforward and clear. I have gotten high A's or above 100 on every exam. Will make you work but he gives you everything you need to do well its up to you to sit down and work through the problems. Redo the lecture and recitation problems & do the hw problems as review

Very hard class, and lecture heavy. Had online class, but lectures were through live video and had to "attend". Very straight forward lecturer, actually really liked the way he teaches. Lecture slides were very easy to follow too. Absolutely need to study to even pass the exams. Again, hard class, but would take another class with him if I could.
He is the worst professor at Ohio State. I feel sorry for anyone who had to endure Marc Smith. Consider taking accounting at CState.
Hard class but set up very well, very organized. Have to study a lot but if you do you will do well in the class.
Class is very difficult, but manageable. You must put in the work to get a good grade. Easy to spend 3 or 4 hours per week outside of class on lectures or quizzes.

Marc really know what he is talking about. I learned a lot from this class. But, his tests are just unfair. If mess up one part on a three or more step problem the entire question is wrong (each question is worth aapprox. 7 points). He is also not very easy to get a hold of and does not seem to care about student success, more so than his own image

One of the worst classes at fisher. Marc Smith makes this class nearly impossible to get through. It is possible to do well but, you had better be taking very easy classes other than this one. The amount of time spent outside of class is 3x more than any other class you will ever take in college. Exams are awful. Take a c state

I simply dont understand why all business students have to take two accounting classes. And hes the only professor. He might be a good professor to someone who likes accounting or accounting majors. But as a non-accounting major I hate this class totally. I dont understand why he makes the intro class incredibly hard and insane.

Does a good job at teaching material in lecture but each exam is made to set you up for failure. I highly recommend watching the lecture videos before lecture and attending lecture even though it is not mandatory.
terrible teacher, avoid at all costs

For Cost Accounting you're looking at 3 quizzes and 3 exams. That is all. 6 grades total. You have to get each question on the exam/quiz 100% right to receive credit for it. You are going to want to make sure you know exactly how to complete questions. Forwards, backwards, upside down, the whole 9 yards. Hopefully you understood accounting.........

Worst class I took at OSU. Made me change my major out of business. Avoid at all costs. Tests are insanely hard and if you make a single little mistake you get no credit. The amount of outside work required is just insane.

Worst professor who has good notes but his exams/quizzes are unfair because he gives no partial credit on them. If you mess one little thing you get zero marks. ALSO, the textbook contributed nothing in learning the material. No curve at the end. Not very accessible outside of class. Take another professor unless you want your GPA to decline.

One of the hardest professor I have met who does not give partial credit on questions, even if you get one part of he question correct it is PLUS ZERO. Other than that, he has really good practice questions.

Marc gives you everything you need to succeed in his classes. He gives great lectures, and as long as you go to class youre 90% of the way there. He clearly cares a lot about his students and understands material through and through. As a result, students respect him.

The class is extremely well organized. Everything is clear and concise. We know what to expect in every week. There are plenty of practice homeworks and lecture problems, which are not graded, so you don't need to be afraid of exams. There are 3 exams, not cumulative. Just look at the modules and finish the stuff for every week, you will be fine.

Marc's online lectures are better than any professor ive ever had. He uses a lot of enthusiasm in his lectures while speaking clearly and loudly. He explains things well. His course layout is extremely straightforward. He replies quickly to emails. Would definitely recommend taking his accounting class.

Marc is an amazing professor. He knows what he is talking about. However, listen to everyone saying to watch the modules and videos and to attend the non-mandatory lectures. The class is very challenging. I really really wanted to be an accountant BUT taking his class has made me hate anything to do with the career.

Everyone makes a big deal out of this class but Marc gives you everything you could possibly need to get an A. Anyone who says anything different just did not go to class, do the homework, or even attempt to master the subject. Tests are 100% fair, you just have to have a deep understanding, as you do with any class. Be attentive, and youll be fine

Marc is a lot less intimidating then he is made out to be. Participate in lecture and show up on time and he'll never give you a hard time. His exams are very difficult but if you study hard all the video modules, lecture problems, and lab problems you should do well. The quizzes are open notes and unlimited time so they are easy points.

I scored better than most of the class. I put in hours and hours of work and thought I had a good grasp on the material. Marc just makes the exams insanely hard. I am incredibly disappointed I put in countless hours and still did not get the grade needed. Remember, you need a b or higher for business students.

Definitely a tough class, however Marc makes it possible to do well. Make sure to watch videos before attending lecture and understating concepts will be much easier. Also theres a free tutor room in Fisher Hall open all weekdays. If you put in the effort you can do well but sometimes the tests are worded so bad and can be tough to do ok

Both Accounting 1 & 2 are pretty tough classes for most people but if you do the work and show up to class it is very doable. Marc is EXTREMELY organized & gives you what you need to succeed. If you watch all the modules, take notes, go to class, and do all the practice problems you should be able to get an A. He knows how to teach!

Marc Smith is beyond organized. The class is easy to follow (format-wise), and as long as you put in decent practice time to review, you will get a good grade. His tests are fair, you just have to work for it! Lectures are optional and recitations are mandatory. I recommend going to both because the more practice, the better.

Marc Smith is by far one of the best professors I've had OSU. He organizes the class very well, delivers the material in a clear and easy to understand format, gives lots of resources for review and practice, and is kind to the students. There definitely needs to be some sort of effort put into this class, but its not hard if the effort is there.

I am the biggest fan of Marc Smith. I would take his class a million times over. His grading criteria is very clear, and if you do everything assigned, you will do well in the class. Again, I love Marc Smith.

Mark smith is a great professor. He is extremely organized, making it easy to learn the course material. The subject matter of the course is not necessarily hard, but you need to put in effort to truly understand the material. To succeed, I recommend watching the lectures, doing the practice problems & going to class & recitation.
Best professor I've yet to have. I'll hopefully be a TA for him next semester.

The best professor Ive had at Ohio State so far. Definitely requires a lot of effort but all of the content is available to you in a very organized way and there are ample opportunities for help outside of class. If you go to class and put in the effort, you can get a B. If youre also interested in the material, you can easily get an A.
He was very hard, but as long as you go to class and do all of the extra practice he provides, you will be ready for exams.

Marc is one of the best Professors at OSU, he's organized and gives you the resources you need to be successful. You have to work for an A but if you commit to the class it's possible. TIPS: always watch lecture videos & take notes(he expects you to), know the concepts like the back of your hand for exams, do the optional HW- its the key to an A.

Very challenging course, but if you watch the lecture videos and do well on the quizzes, you can leave with an A. He curves at the end so if you aim for a B, the curve should bump you to an A or A-. Don't slack off and make sure you work in groups to do the quizzes.

Marc Smith makes accounting very easy to understand, even if you aren't that great at math. I've always heard nightmares about this class, but it really isn't too bad. Marc Smith has very helpful and engaging lectures, and there is extra credit on every exam. The exams aren't cumulative, which is nice

He is a really nice guy but he automatically acts like everyone knows accounting! this does not seem like its really for beginners. The exam practices are not like real exam. Way to much info to remember for each exam. Should be more than just one class a week.

Even though the attendance was not mandatory I would recommend attending class. Even with all the notes its just way to much information to remember for each exams. I would understand if he gave us a formula sheet but no we don't get one. The test times are reasonable but I not once finished. Also the practice exams are not like exams!
Study and keep up with the material and you'll do decently. Not easy, but nothing is unexpected. Organized lessons, non-cumulative testing. Labs required and beneficial, lecture hall is not req'd.

Mark is one of the best professors I have had at Ohio State. His lectures are very interesting and he provides you with an abundance of resources to prepare for exams. He truly cares for his students and wants you to be comfortable with the material.
The professor teaches lecture pretty well but you need to spend much time to study for the exam. It is pretty hard.
The worst professor in OSU so far. His lecture aren't helpful and except you to come in to class assuming you're already a God Tier Accounting Student.

Most organized class I've ever taken at Ohio State. Holds your attention in lecture for a class that is normally brutal to focus in. If you put in the work and show up to class you get a good grade just from hearing him lecture and speak

He is almost the lowest quality professor I meet in OSU. If you look at the phone, he will say get out or scold you at the class, his class is the only class that can't look at phone in the room. Class is not difficult but he make the class difficult and boring.
Not very helpful. Hard class. Time consuming. Confusing. Unresponsive.

He's great, but the exams are fairly difficult. Here's how to get an A: Go to every recitation, lecture isn't as important tbh. Watch all the modules at some point and write notes. Do the homework after watching each week's modules. Then do the practice exam a day before-ish. You'll get a good grade, you just have to work harder than usual.

Marc Smith is a great professor. If you take this class, attending the in-person recitation will be of great help. He is very energetic and draws a lot of class participation. If you take the time in the class, unlike me, you should get a good grade very easily. Just be careful on exams because there is no partial credit.

The online videos he made do a really good job of explaining the concepts, and then the weekly recitation is helpful as well. I learned a lot, would always recommend to do the homework even though it isn't graded, its helpful in learning the material.

Gives you all the tools you need to succeed in the class. Going in, I was scared because everyone tells you horror stories about this class. Great lecturer and provides you with more than enough help. Lectures can be scary because he calls on random people, but as long as you come prepared, it was a great class that made me really enjoy accounting.

Marc is a great professor, but he is not very nice when going to lecture. He is not chill at all and treats students like 7 year olds, watching whether or not they use their phones. The class is stupidly easy though. Requires about 2 or 3 hours of studying before exams to get an a

I honestly think Marc Smith is one of the greatest professors at Ohio State. He gets torn down because his class is said to be incredibly hard, but he gives you absolutely everything you need to know. I would really recommend going to every class and watching the lectures. This class isn't incredibly hard but keep up with the materials for an A.
I liked this class was because he gave us a huge curve at the end of the semester. There is no other reason. I went into the final with a 67% and ended with a 72%, which he considered a B-.

Marc knows what he's doing, but this class is TOUGH. You HAVE to go to recitation/ problem solving sessions and watch every module if you want to do well on the exams. A lot of accounting is just practice, and he definitely gives the opportunity to do so, just make sure you show up, watch the modules, and practice the concepts outside of class.

I feel like he doesn't even know what he's talking about. He gets his own homework problems wrong in office hours, and with him, there is no such thing as a formula sheet, so we have to memorize 1000 formulas for each exam. The only grades are 3 exams and 5 quizzes, all or nothing grades. It seems like my entire class is not doing well.

The grade was solely based on 5 quizzes and 3 exams. There is no partial credit and when asking for help he sent me away to watch the lecture videos even though I already had and made clear to him that I still did not understand. Does not care if you pass or fail, would avoid if possible.

Marc was one of the worst professors I've had at Ohio State. Over an hour of online lectures each week, and the in class lecture is one practice problem. He is so belittling when talking to him individually. I went to his office hours and he would not listen to me at all. I understand it is a hard class, and Marc was engaging, but not respectful.

Marc may be the greatest professor in Fisher. Information is covered 5 times. I would recommend watching videos first, attending lecture, going to lab, doing the homework, and completing the practice exams. I cant imagine not being able to get at least an A- if you use everything he gives you. I learned more from his class than anywhere else. Hey
Pre-lecture videos required for each lecture and he calls on random students to make you look dumb if you don't watch the videos!

Marc is one of the best professors at Ohio State. The material is hard, but he gives you everything you need to be prepared for the tests. If you study the material, attend lecture, watch the videos, and do the practice exams, you should be able to get a good grade. There's a reason he's the only beginning accounting professor at OSU.
Marc is my favorite professor at Ohio State. You will learn a lot from his courses. Very passionate about the material every week. Do the practice problems before the exam and you'll be fine.

Marc is probably my favorite professor at Ohio State. He is genuine and tries to make lectures not boring. He likes to call on kids so watch the videos before lecture! Watch all the videos, take notes on them, go to class, practice the problems. I put in very little effort and got a B+. If you try you will get an A. Very straightforward course.

Covers a ton of information and tests on it all. Forces you to have a thorough understanding to pass. Exams are tricky. Content is well organized. Very challenging if you aren't good with numbers, highly recommend tudor hours.

Marc Smith is by far the best professor Ive ever had. I had him for 2200 and 2300, which were my two favorite classes at OSU so far. Of course Im an accounting major but Marc is easy to understand, gives you many materials, and really wants to help you. You cannot have a better Professor than Marc got any accounting course

Marc is very nice but he's not extremely helpful. The lectures are long, he covers a lot of material and he tests on ALL of it so be prepared. There isn't any multiple choice and the tests are long. If you didn't study hard you won't finish the tests and you will struggle in the course.
I really enjoyed having Prof. Smith. If you do everything to prepare for this class he makes the content very understandable. It's not an easy A but he gives you all the tools you need for success.
worst class I have taken yet at OSU. take it somewhere else.
He's an amazing professor.

Marc is a great professor. I have had him for 3 classes now and he makes it really easy to learn the course material. If you put in the effort and are generally interested in learning his classes are not hard. You just need to put a decent amount of work in.

Marc makes it CLEAR what you need to do for the class. His online videos and lectures make it easier to understand what can be complicated material. All due dates an expectations for the course are set day 1. I wish all my classes were organized like Marc's classes. (ACCTMIS 2200, 2300)

Marc Smith is honestly the best professor I have yet to have an Ohio State. He keeps lecture interesting and fun. Watching the online videos before lecture is key to being successful I would say. Study hard for exams and put in work on quizzes and you should succeed.
Extremely great teacher. He provides students with all the materials needed to succeed. He makes the topic as easy as possible to understand.

Marc is a very organized professor who is very clear from the beginning about what is expected in order to be successful. Be prepared for online lectures or "modules", which usually take two hours per week along with optional homework problems. I recommend going to both lecture and recitation every week. Exams are difficult but manageable.

Marc is a solid guy, and his video lectures are really useful. If you have recitation make sure you go because attendance is mandatory. The quizzes are tough but the worst one is dropped. The way he grades exams kinda sucks but it makes sense when you realize how many students he has. Overall, study and watch lectures and you can get an A.

Idk how his rating is that high. Worst class I have ever taken. I did less work in Calculus 2. Grading is EXTREMELY difficult and unfair. Exams are way too many points and no partial credit on extended responses which are a ton of your grade. Gonna have to take again over summer somewhere else. WORST CLASS EVER. Avoid at all costs!!

Marc Smith is amazing. If all of the professors could be like Marc, my life would have been better. He's extremely organized. He's transparent with his grading and expectation. His materials are a gem. He really makes you work hard for something but an A is attainable. Watch the videos, do the problems, go to lectures and recitation.

Marc Smith is one of the best professors at Ohio State. He is so organized and the criteria is so clear and clean cut. He provides a great amount of study materials. The exams are hard and tricky, but you come out of the class very knowledgeable. He is friendly and respectable. Got an A on all of the exams with no previous knowledge. Just study.

If you go to all the lectures, watch all the lecture modules and do your homework, its almost impossible not to get a good grade. This class is so organized the only reason people complain about it is probably because they don't go to lecture so they don't understand what's going on. Seriously, if you just listen to Marc, the class is easy.

Worst class I have taken so far at OSU. You could get all of the multiple choice right but his problems at the end of exams are 10 points a piece and impossible to solve. If he was really that smart with accounting he wouldn't be a professor, he would be a real CPA. He also is the ONLY accounting 2000 professor at OSU at ALL campuses.

Marc is a great professor if you are trying to major in Accounting. Most organized online class I've ever taken. HOWEVER, he does not give any partial credit whatsoever and grades unfairly hard. I'm a straight A student and I cannot seem to pass any of his quizzes. This class consumes all of my time and I'm not even an Act major...
The most organized professor I have ever had. As long as you watch the modules and come to class this class is pretty easy.
avoid at all costs
Acts like you're going to be a CPA tomorrow.
Marc Smith makes you work hard and it is important that you keep up with the modules.

One of the best lecturers I've had so far, if not the best. Video lectures amazing, so easy to understand. Many will say it is impossible, but as long as you go to all the lectures and recitations, you will be fine. Study hard for the exams, and getting an A is not impossible at all! Overall, the class is so organized and well structured!

Marc Smith is a phenomenal teacher. The course structure is set up for student to have success. I unfortunately followed everything he recommended students do and still failed.. be ware of tricky/time crunch exams. Nonetheless, he is one of the most organized teachers I have ever had! I wish he taught all my other business classes.

I think Marc is a good guy and a fine professor. However, he makes this class unnecessarily hard for just being a standard business core class. Tests and quizzes are filled to the brim with trick questions and no partial credit really hurts. I didn't put in that much effort so I cant complain. Its hard but if you genuinely try you'll do well

Online material. Organized well. DO NOT FALL BEHIND. Must have initiative/work independently. Quizzes/Tests are the only grades. Quizzes open book/note. Tests difficult; he tries to trick you by changing dates on problems. Class examples similar to the tests. DO NOT PLAY ON YOUR PHONE IN THIS CLASS. He will scream at you in front of everyone.

The GOAT. Marc is everything you can ask for in a professors. Class is hard, but if you do what he tells you, you should do well. Do as best you can on the quizzes because the exams are difficult. No partial credit. Go to class because he will give hints about the exam. Practice as much as you can. No need for the textbook. Nice curve at the end.

Marc is one of the best professors I've had in Fisher if not thee best. Accounting can be dry but if you go to his lectures you'll notice he is full of energy, very engaging, and quite frankly a clown. People find this class to be difficult because you do need to know the material well. However, if you go to class and do hw its an easy class.

Hardest class I have taken thus far at OSU. All lectures are online; you only meet once a week for a one hour lecture, where he goes over practice problems. He picks on students during lecture and his exams are near impossible. Only have 8 grades in total. Horrible class.

I absolutely despise accounting as I find it extremely tedious. That being said, I learned a lot in this class. It is difficult and work heavy but if you put in the time you can do well and learn a lot. Marc is very organized and what you see is what you get. Overall surprised at how valuable I found this class to be.

Very time consuming class but if you do the practice problems, lecture problems, watch all the modules, and attend class- you will be fine. He gives you all the resources to succeed but putting in the hours and days of work to get familiar with the material is what throws people off. Study the lecture and recitation problems and use the tutor room.

If you do the work you'll be fine. Lectures and lecture videos are awesome, he'll never test you on something he hasn't explained thoroughly. Do the practice problems and the class isn't hard at all. He's a great prof and every time I went to office hours he was patient with me and answered every question I had

The best professor I have had in Fisher. Extremely organized and you learn a great deal from his course. If you keep up on the material and put in the work you can get a good grade. Tests can be tricky but he puts out so much practice material to study with.

Had Marc for 4 classes (2200, 2300, 3200, and 4200). One of the best lecturers at Fisher. Exams and quizzes can be challenging, but not impossible if you put in the work. Feel like I learned a lot in all 4 classes. Only used the book for the suggested problems in 3200 and 4200. Exams only cover concepts mentioned in class.

Marc is genuinely a really good teacher. He knows what he is talking about but he makes sure to simplify it as much as possible. You have a lecture where he goes over practice problems, a recitation with more practice problems, and the lectures are all online, so as long as you have good time management to watch lectures you'll do fine.

(2200 & 2300). Mark is a great instructor, he gives you all the tools you need to succeed. He teaches at the basic level and expects you to apply the knowledge to the optional homework. If you do the homework and memorize the formulas the class isn't too bad. Exams are time consuming so make so your practice to breeze through them!

Marc Smith gets a bad rep because Accounting is just a very hard class in general. People who complain that the lecture problems were way easier than the exam problems clearly did not put in the effort to prepare themselves for the exam. Smith puts up TONS of practice problems on Carmen that will prepare you for the exams if you actually do them.

Class is set up really poorly. Like many have said, you go over a problem in lecture that is extremely easy and then get to the exams only to be hit with a problem that you would never expect and is difficult to complete. His class will easily hurt your GPA if you cant put all available time into it. No partial credit what-so-ever.

Class is set up in a horrible way where you meet once a week for an hour and he goes over an easy problem. The quizzes and exams are much more difficult than any in class problem ever is. Not nearly enough time is spent with him actually teaching or explaining things.

He is very organized and gives you every chance to succeed if you put in the effort. If you do everything he says you'll do fine. Personally, my favorite professor of all time since he is well organized and will prepare you very well for the exams. Definitely would recommend!

Overall, this professor was really good in my opinion. If you put in the effort to go to class and do the work, you'll be fine. He is one of the only professors where I can confidently say that when I go to class I learn every time.

Marc's classes are great if you love consistency. The format for his two classes are exactly the same and the tests are all written in the same way. You do have to study every video, recitation problem, and lecture problem. He does a great job of explaining everything he wants you to know and he gives a great background to accounting.
His class is helpless, just meet his less one hour per week, and He is so mean.

The most relentless, unforgiving grader. If you mess up on one little thing you get a 0 for the problem. Doesn't waste any of his effort trying to do difficult problems during his lecture. Instead he goes over really easy ones that you'd never see on his exams. Overall he is not a good professor and his class will likely hurt your GPA.
Overall, great professor! If you watch the online lectures, go to recitations, and study the material you should do fine. Marc is an awesome guy and sets up a lot of resources to help students.

Very clear how to get an A in the class on day one. Watch the modules, go to lecture, go to recitation in that order and the class is an easy A. I would say he is one of the best professors that I have had, people only struggle because they dont go to lecture or watch the modules. Dont make the class hard, its very easy.
Marc's online lectures are super good for learning and reviewing. A lot to learn, but if you put time, no hard.

All of the lectures are online. And the weekly class meeting is also recorded and online. So you don't have to show up. Beware though that there is a lot of material to go through, and only three tests. So one small mistake could mean that you get an entire problem wrong, which has a huge impact on your grade.
The test is hard. the Professor is mean

If you aren't willing to put in the work you will not do well. Simple as that He gives you more than enough practice materials to be well prepared for his exams. The biggest thing with this class is to keep up with it every week and do not get behind. If you put in time outside of class you will get an A! Exams are similar to his practice materials

Accounting 1 and 2 are pretty straightforward classes. You do the work, you get an A.  Exams are pretty easy if you know the material. Quizzes are easy because he gives you infinite time to do them and you can get a group going for it. Curve is based on highest final grade in the class. Depending on your campus, attendance can be mandatory.
Hardest class ever! Not very helpful! Class is basically online, show up once a week. He does a problem and you leave. Its very hard to ask questions and get help.

Marc is by far the most organized professor I've ever had. Granted, his exams are quite challenging and long, but the content of the course is perfectly set up. It's easy to fall behind so keeping up with watching lecture videos before the problem solving session and recitations is a must. He teaches in a very clear and organized manner.

I love Marc Smith! His class is definitely difficult but he structures it so well and really gives you no excuse not to do well. He is a great teacher and explains things really well. The exams are pretty difficult but if you spend time understanding the concepts, you will do pretty well. The quizzes are a great boost to your grade also!

Marc Smith is EASILY one of the best professors I've ever had. Accounting 2200 and 2300 are not "breeze by" courses-- know that!   How to get an A:  -Watch video lectures and take detailed notes (MOST IMPORTANT)! -Go to lecture & recitation (Pay attention, find tricky patterns) -Don't do the quiz alone -For exam: PRACTICE!!

This class is hard, and is constantly trying to trick you. However, Marc Smith is one of the most knowledgeable professors I've had. He knows what he wants and how he wants it. Practice everything repetitively, and work hard to do well on the quizzes because they will make or break you. Exams get easier as they go along, but never slack off.

Marc Smith is a tough professor, no question. DO THE WORK. Go to class, do all the practice problems, study the definitions. Absolutely don't get behind. If you got that, you'll be just fine.  My only complaint is that the quizzes are rough. He throws in new stuff that you haven't seen before. But, collaborate and you'll be okay.

Say what you want about Marc Smith, but he is a good teacher. Class is super organized and lecture videos are easy to follow. My biggest complaint with Marc is that it seems he goes out of his way to trick you on exams. I don't see why he wants to make the tests as hard as possible. you have to apply what you learn, not just memorize.

Well organized and non cumulative tests is the only thing he has going for himself. however, one test can be a half a semester of material in most classes. Smith assumes that you're only taking his class. If you want to question if you are cut out for college take his class and watch your life become sadder every day

Class is all online power points with voiceover.  The powerpoint are detailed/organized but they cover a lot of material. the people who pass collaborate with others on quizzes.  I hired a 25 year CPA and ex professor to tutor me and take quizzes. With his help still got a 50 percent on quizzes. no partial credit on tests and Quizzes

Tough, tough teacher. There's no face to face instructions so that people who aren't good at visual learning like me will straight up fail the class. I got around fifty percent before I drop the class. If you get one number digit wrong in the quiz, you get the whole thing wrong. Extremely difficult class, hard to follow and forced video watching.

Take  detailed notes from the video lectures and make sure you have all the material understood for the quizes. They're easy and online so you can use your notes. The exams seem easy at first but once you get the grade back you realize how easily you can be tricked on questions.  Marc is great. He utilizes Carmen well and responds quick to emails.

Not one regret about taking his classes, not that you really have a choice to take Marc for 2200 and 2300.  One of the few professors at Ohio State that I've encountered that truly care about you learning.  2200 and 2300 aren't memorization, it's learning the material and applying it to real-world accounting problems.

Marc Smith is one of the best professors that I have ever had. People complain of his class being difficult but if you keep up with it, it's actually pretty easy. The way the class is set up it is easy to learn the material. Exams are very fair if you actually go to class and keep up. The quizzes are tough, but collaboration is allowed.

Great teacher. Demonstrates how to take a complex problem and simplify it. Online videos prep you for recitation. Recitation preps you for test. Exams are fairly similar to practice problems you'll work through together. No random exam questions, can be tricky though. Very methodical problem solver. Highly recommend!!

The hardest class I've ever taken and worst grade I've ever gotten, if you can avoid this class DO IT! Got all A's and A-'s in my other course this semester and barely passed accounting. Have to learn everything on your own and teach yourself. The worst wish I would've taken it at C-State

Based on reviews on here, I thought this class would be very challenging. It was at times. I watched all the lectures while taking notes and attended every class. Marc gives hints on what will be on the exams during practice sessions. I did this and got a B before the curve and an A- after the curve. IF you put in effort, you will be fine.

Pros: Organized; doesn't waste your time if class is over.  Cons: Hardest professor I've ever taken. Questions extremely complex and difficult, have many parts and take 30+ minutes to complete; oh yeah, did I mention he makes the class as hard as possible? Do not take any class with this Marcy Marc if you can avoid him. to get a C is a struggle.

He's the best when it comes to accounting.  He makes somewhat difficult material extremely easy.  Passed both 2200 & 2300 with A's before the curve. Most organized professor I've ever had.  If you do what he tells you to do on the first day of class you'll be fine.

Marc Smith, although very easy on the eyes, is one of the hardest professors I have ever had. You need to be very disciplined with the lectures and practice problems to barely stay afloat. He is very passionate but should not be an intro to accounting teacher, he takes it way to seriously. I would suggest taking it somewhere else. (Love the hair)

Marc Smith is the GOAT. Phenomenal lecturer, keeps everyone very engaged despite accounting being a relatively dry subject. He makes things interesting and explains topics and the details very, very well. Best professor I've ever had, very excited to take 2300 with him as well.
YOU HAVE TO WATCH THE LECTURE VIDEOS. Do the practice problems 6 million and half times because he will go out of his way to try to trick you as much as possible.

I love Marc Smith and I hate accounting. Basically how my semester went. Do the work and put the effort in for the exam and you will be fine. The content was kind of difficult for me as I've never taken a business course in my life, but Marc is a great teacher. He's great at walking you through examples.

Marc Smith is a good professor. I find him annoying as a person, but he knows what he's talking about. The material, while not difficult, is annoyingly finicky at times. Most questions on tests and quizzes are very specific. My main complaint is that the lectures have his stupid face sitting in the corner the whole time.
Tough class but good teacher. Very well organized.

this class is so hard. the exams and quizzes are all memorization and if you don't have an iq of 150+ it's impossible to do good. i got a d because there is no way to study for his tests. he make is at as hard as he can. good luck remembering every single detail in the powerpoints!! avoid at all cost

Marc Smith is one of my favorite professors at OSU!! He condenses everything down to what you need to no, no extra fluff or BS work.  He wants to see you succeed and is always willing to help.  Make sure you do the practice problems and you are golden.

Marc communicates the material very clearly and very willing to answer any questions you may have.  The class is not very hard as long as you pay attention to lectures and do all of the work.  He is VERY strict about no cell phones in class, which is a bit unusual for a college professor, but just don't try to use your phone in class.

Marc is the best professor I've ever had at Ohio State. The class is very organized and same format week to week.  As long as you watch the videos and take notes then it is an easy class if you do the homework as well. Would definitely take another class with Marc again.

I am taking 2200 this summer. Marc is very passionate about teaching, and he explains everything clearly. It is a great course to take during summer. No homework to be graded. Midterms are tough, but getting A is not impossible.

I actually learned a lot from this course. His exams are pretty difficult but if you dont get behind and do the required hw and watch the modules each week, you will do fine. I highly recommend doing the weekly hw as many times as you can during that week. He definitely makes you work to be successful in this class. Overall, great professor.

Marc explains the material very well and is easy to understand, but the exams and quizzes are pretty difficult and they do not look anything like the homework or module problems. To receive a good grade, you need to know the material inside out because most of his exam and quiz questions are "critical thinking" based questions.

Marc is the most organized professor I've ever had at OSU. The tests are very similar to the practice exams that he posts. Watch the modules (take notes), and pay attention during lab and you should be fine. Go to the tutor room for any questions with quizzes, they are helpful.

Both classes are structured the same way. Marc is great, he's very clear when explaining things. Lectures are online videos, 6 quizzes and the lowest is dropped.  I felt like exams were usually fair, make sure you know how to do the practice problems but also review and understand the concepts/definitions. No textbook required or needed at all.

Before I take this class, I heard lots of student talking about how diff between HW and exams. However, after I take his class, i think professor smith did a good job. Online lecture is very helpful and well organized. Attending recitation and lab is really IMPORTANT!! HW are easy and you can drop one lowest. Listen video, attend class, easy A

Very poor professor. Quizzes and exams ask questions that cover very obscure concepts barely touched upon in lecture and recitation, and of course they don't at all resemble homework and practice problems. The level of difficulty for this course is insanely high, even if you diligently keep up with the material. Don't expect a good grade.
this class is a joke he baby's us through it all. tests aren't cumulative. you don't need the textbook.

Marc is an excellent teacher. Watch the online lecture modules, go to recitation and problem session, and things should come fairly easy. Take advantage of tutor rooms for quizzes, they are very helpful! Most test answers are all or nothing, so be careful and pay attention to detail. Class is mostly just memorizing a lot of formulas and using them.

If you are taking ACCT 2000 and your major requires you to take math beyond algebra, you will have no trouble with this class at all. As long as you watch the lectures, take notes, go to the weekly recitation, and do the optional homework, you will be fine. Learn the concepts and the math is extremely easy.
DO NOT SKIP THE CLASS
Much more difficult, exams look nothing like practice. Be prepared to just way wtf to yourself after exams.
All tests are all or nothing for every question. In my opinion, far easier than accounting 2. Super high curve at end of class to those with low grades, not much curve 80-85% at all.
What he taught in the class in useless in the exam and you would find what you have done is in vain

Video modules are very helpful, but that doesn't mean skip the recitation section. More helpful than the modules is seeing him work through problems in person. Great at explaining things, best professor I've had at OSU.
The one thing I like about both Marc and this class is that there are online lectures for the content he covers. He lectures VERY specifically and is extremely thorough in educating the content.

Marc is a great professor, he gives students all the tools to succeed, it all comes down to the work you put in to the class. If you watch the lecture modules, go to recitation with Marc, and pay attention in Lab with your TA it is easy to succeed. The tutor room is also very helpful for help on the quizzes. Know the material and you can do well.

As long as you actually watch the videos, go to class and pay attention, you should do well in learning the material. If you understand it, exams should be easy. Marc is great at explaining things and very helpful if you ask questions! Best professor I've had at OSU.

This class is really taught online in video modules and class time is used to go through examples - which I loved. The videos were made my Marc and they are very clear, but YOU MUST STAY ON TOP OF THEM AND DON'T GET BEHIND. This is an easy A if you watch every video and do the practice problems and go to class! But no cell phones, he's serious.
Went to the tutor room and one of the tutors said that Columbus State accounting is hard. Recommend Vignos for a problem session leader he teaches the material 10 times better than Marc ever could.
Terrible class. He does not know how to teach students. Does not provide a class for learning. Prepare to teach yourself. ATTEND ALL LECTURES!

Marc is one of my favorite professors so far at OSU. Hes energetic; keeps you interested during class. Watching the online modules for lecture helped A LOT. Going to recitation and "lab" and doing practice problems really helped cement the concepts into your head. Tests were still difficult though, if you mess up 1 thing, could hurt other problems

He does not do lectures just labs. All lecture are prerecord that you watch on line. For some people this may work but for me I need to be in person to grasp and be able to ask questions. My own advisor told me to talk this class at Columbus State or another small school and just transfer the credits.  Take that advice just get a transfer credit.

Marc is an average professor, he is great at accounting and like it but makes the class unnecessarily difficult. You have to do your own work and teach yourself every week or you will fall behind. I put in a lot of work, and did every problem available at least twice for each exam and still did very bad, he chooses the most difficult Q's on exams.
If you put in the work, you will succeed in this class. Accounting is all about meticulous detail, but Marc is great at presenting concepts.

Make sure you take the time to actually go to lecture and pay attention. If you put in the work, the class really isn't that bad. I took 2200 with cases and 2300 when they took them out.. it's a lot better without them. Be sure to go over all the in class practice problems. Exams are long, but if you know the material well, you'll have enough time.

Watch all the online modules, no matter how boring they are. Recitation and lab are a must for better understanding of the concepts. Class isn't difficult and concepts aren't tough to grasp. The effort you apply will be in direct proportion to the results you achieve.
Exams are hard. Some of the questions were just there to kill your grades.

Marc Smith was my kind of professor. Lecture modules online and class only one day a week. Have optional practice homework and mandatory quizzes every other week. If you practice all the examples given before each exam, then you should do well. I got an A on every test but I studied hard. Marc is a good, yet slightly challenging professor.

Your grade is entirely determined by your effort. Go to class, pay attention to the problems he gives you, do the practice exam, do the practice problems and you cannot get worse than a B. Also, the tutor room is very helpful, they will ensure you are always on the right track and help with quizzes
The class was very easy if you watched the videos and did the problems. Marc is a nice guy, and everything on the tests and quizzes are straight out of the concepts covered online and in problems.

His lectures and slides are straightforward and will teach you everything you need to know. There are plenty of examples, but since much of the class isn't in person there isn't much interactivity. All the exams have 100% coverage of the material, so you have to make sure you understand all of it.

Marc Smith is one of the best professors in Fisher. He's very clear about the work that needs to be done in the class and the class is very organized. In order to do well on the exams,  you have to be able to do all the homework problems as well as the problem worksheets from class without looking at your notes.

Marc gives you all the tools to succeed. HIs recitations are engaging and helpful. Unless you are an accounting genius, you will need to stay up on the work in order to do well in the class. This class will teach you a lot about accounting and sharpen your eye for detail

Marc Smith is extremely helpful in both office hours and through his online lectures. Take notes on the lectures and attend the "lab"/recitation and do the practice exams and the classes aren't difficult.

This class is time consuming, and the tests are very difficult. Test questions are often problems that you've never seen before in recitation or the practice problems. But if you understand the material, you will be able to solve the problems. Take advantage of the tutoring room.

Marc Smith is undoubtedly the most organized professor I've ever had. Everything from his video lectures, to recitations, to lab setup, is extremely clear and organized. He tends to try to trick you on exams, but if you keep up with the material and practice everything until you are positive you understand it, you will do well.

Take accounting elsewhere. The focus is more on a students ability to solve page long problems that will require you to use 2+ pages of paper just to solve. Test can have 3-4 problems and it will take most of the hour and half to complete. Many students don't finish. Memorization of formulas required. Calculus was easier. Professor is energetic.

This class is pure memorization. Make flashcards of the notes and study them and you should do fine on the exams. Marc is by far the best teacher I have ever had at OSU though and I would have taken all of my accounting classes with him if I could.

Marc Smith is the best teacher I have ever had at OSU. His lectures are interesting and he's always willing to help. The exams are tricky, but he truly cares about his students and wants to see you succeed. If you take his advice and spend the time to do the practice problems on your own a few times, you will do good on the exams, simple as that.

Marc is a great professor.  The dude absolutely loves accounting which is great but also can be annoying at times.  Tests are hard, quizzes not easy either.  Must work your butt off if you want an A or a high B.

He's without a doubt one of the best teachers at Fisher, but also the most unreasonably tough. The important thing to know going into this class is that there is no partial credit on tests, and that no topic is too small to be featured on the tests. You have to know every inch of the material, and more importantly you need to be able to do it fast.
Average class that he makes unnecessarily hard.  Exams cover every single possible thing.  If you stay on top of it, you will do well.  Don't expect an A.

The lectures are online for this class.  We met once a week for a recitation-like class. I loved this layout - the lecture modules were extremely organized and clear.  If you stay on track with them then you should be good. There are also practice problems that are great practice and the exams are exactly like them!

Very clear online lectures that have nothing to do with the quizzes. Emphasizes doing many practice problems, but the exam problems are not even close to the problems he gives. Take this class at Columbus State, the credits transfer without any issues and is half the work. I learned my lesson, and will be taking ACCT 2300 at Columbus State.

Lectures are online.  They can make sense but then when you go to do the quizzes you will realize that you learned nothing.  Exams are extremely difficult.  Accounting tutor room is very helpful but the exams just killed me.  Ended up getting a W and taking it at C-State.  Highly recommend C-state.
Marc Smith gives really hard tests but I find them okay because he is an excellent lecturer. The class is extremely well organized that if you do the work, you should do well.

The exams are way more difficult than they need to be. They have the absolute hardest problems on the exam that aren't even similar to what you go over in lecture and in labs with the TAs. I watched the online lectures, did the optional homework, didn't miss a class and I'm still stressing out about my final grade in the class.

Marc is a crystal-clear lecturer and the class environment is interactive and enjoyable. You MUST do the  related online modules prior to the class or you will not understand. Exams have no partial credit, so you must practice. To get an A, all you need to do is (1) watch modules, (2) do the homework 3x a week, (3) go to the tutor room

Just like 2200, this class is online modules and lecture where Marc does one problem.  Not helpful AT ALL. I didn't understand the information and didn't like having to teach myself.  Failed the first exam and immediately withdrew to save my GPA. Take accounting somewhere else unless this is your type of class layout or strong subject.

This class is weekly online modules where you teach yourself then show up to class and have Marc do one problem. Recitation with a TA is similar.
