If you don't like classes where you have to teach yourself, take accounting at CState. This class destroyed my GPA because I didn't understand the material and he didn't explain things clearly.

Marc Smith is quite the character. He is definitely out there and loud, but knows his stuff and teaches it well. Very nice guy. I've had him for both 2200 and 2300. Classes are set up REAL NICE. 1000 points 50 attendance @ recitation (1 a week)  200 points online quizzes (best 4 of 6) 250 pt exam 250 pt exam 250 pt exam

To me, this class is the epitome of everything that is wrong with Ohio State. Taught through a series of drawn out online modules with one scheduled weekly class meeting, in a lecture hall with 200 other students. Marc does one example, then we all leave. It is so difficult! The quizzes are hard, the exams crowdedhard. INSANE WORK BUT NO LEARNING

Marc's online lecture modules were VERY easy to follow. He made the material easy to understand. He is pretty funny in recitation, but is VERY serious about the learning environment. DON'T LET HIM SEE YOUR CELL PHONE. You will be asked to leave in front of the entire lecture hall. I appreciate his dedication and would take a class with him again!

I can't believe Marc Smith is rated this highly.  I really want to give him all zeros to even it out, but I have tried to be accurate.  Do not expect to learn accounting in this class.  Expect:  memorization of formulas and procedures with little understanding of what they mean;  hours of dedication weekly.  2200 and 2300 are GPA killers for many.

Marc is great. He's there to help you learn and his exams are fair, but tough. If you put the work in, go to class, and stay on top of all deadlines you'll be fine.  If you have a question Marc is more than willing to help. He loves doing what he does, and it shows in his enthusiasm to help students.

The topics themselves are not very difficult. However the quizzes and exams are. Exams this semester were very long and difficult problems. Quizzes have questions that cannot even be solved without some sort of help. If you are not an accounting major just remember you are almost done with it.

One of the best accounting teachers I have ever had, not to mention one of the very few that I felt was genuinely interested and passionate about the subject. However, he's challenging and he expects a lot out of you, and there's no partial credit on the exams. So study and go to the tutor rooms or you won't pass

Expect to watch online video lectures and take notes for 4 hours per week. No material is taught in person. Marc is very clear, but there is a lot of material to learn which can be overwhelming. Do not fall behind. Class is heavily curved. Some say this is a weed out class for Fischer. Start studying a week in advance for each exam or you will fail

A lot of people hate on Marc but he was easily the best professor I've had at Ohio State. All his lectures, practice problems, and course materials are very organized and he gives you more than enough material (homework problems, lecture problems, practice problems, practice exams) to be able to succeed. Just need to put in the effort

Marc comes off as a tough professor at first. Once you get to know him and get through 2200 you will gain a lot more respect for him. The class is set up in a fashion that is very helpful to students but does take some time to complete all the material. Don't use your phone in class. Just don't. Seriously.

Marc is crystal clear in explaining all of the concepts in detail. This class can be challenging (especially since most people are only taking it as a prerequisite for finance and don't really care that much), but if you follow along with the modules, go to recitation, and rework the practice problems and practice exams before tests, you'll be fine

This is a tough class. Make sure you understand all the concepts thoroughly. Do ALL the practice problems. If you do this... the tests are just plug and chug and aren't a big deal. Marc is a very good instructor and if you pay attention and put enough work in you'll be fine. Also... if you've already taken Acct. 2200, you know what to expect.

The more time you put in the better grade you will get, there are no exceptions to that in his class. That goes for 2300 and 2200. Do the practice problems and print out the quizes so you have more practice problems to do when you study for exams. Speaking of the quiz, if you dont work with other people on it, you will fail. Dont skip a week on the lecture modules and if you have questions go to the tutor room, they are very helpful. Overall a great professor, but he makes you put in the effort.

Marc is extremely clear in his explanations - he goes through every concept in detail and makes sure that you get it. Do the homework problems on carmen, even though they're not graded. Exams are tough - you miss a couple questions by even a single number and your score drops by a lot. Overall, the material is pretty basic and easy to understand.

His recitations are engaging, & you must attend them regularly to pass.  He goes over more detailed, exam-like problems in recitation than the ones in lecture, and always takes a couple moments to ask if anyone has questions.  You'll spend about 2-3 hours outside of class per week.  I studied, on average, 14-16 hours for each exam. Put the work in.

The honest truth about this class- it's hard, with MANY details to remember, and truly, you'll STRUGGLE OR FAIL if you don't keep up with the material. Marc has high expectations (do NOT text during his lectures, he will throw you out), but his online lectures are amazingly clear if you pay attention. Work hard, study harder, and you'll do fine.

Impossible tests, endless hours of lecture.  Both ACCT 2200 and 2300 are offered at CState online, and can be taken at the same time.  TAKE AT CSTATE.  This course demands at least 4 hours of weekly studying, and that's not including midtermsfinals week!

At the beginning of the class, Marc will try to sell everyone that the rumors that his tests are unfair are false, and that as long as you keep up with the online lectures, attend physical lecture and recitations, you'll be good... What he doesn't tell you is that class takes 9 hours AT LEAST weekly, and that tests are impossible.  TAKE AT CSTATE!!
This class is a hard one for sure but if you spend time on it you can pass! I love the way the class is set up because I can study on my own time and it is really convenient.
hard

He is a great teacher, the class is all what you put into it. I strongly recommend watching the online modules, doing the practice problems,  and going to recitation. If you do these things you will get A's on the exams.

His online lectures literally give you everything you need for the tests.  Go to recitation, he goes over specific things that you may have a tough time with on the tests.  He is definitely my favorite professor.
Marc Smith isn't given enough credit for his teaching style. His online lectures and clear and concise, and his in person recitations are an amazing way of solidifying the concepts. Great professor.

Well, the material of the this class is not very difficult, however you have to do a lot of work every week so you can keep up with it. But, the worst part in this class is the lab, where you probably are going to lose all points you have gained in exams and quizzes.

One of the best professors in Fisher with clear logic, great knowledge and easy going personality. The two accounting core courses that every one has to take are tough, but as you do what Marc says in the first class, you should be fine. Really need to watch his videos, and finish every problems sets. A ton of work, but you can learn a lot as well

Best teacher in the Business school. Expects that students keep up to date with the information presented in class. If you show up to class, take good notes, and keep up with it, you will do well. If you try to study 2 days before the test, you will fail.

DO NOT TAKE THIS COURSE AT OSU. Marc Smith has to honestly be the worst professor I've ever had. Yes- the course is tough. But Marc Smith is NO help what so ever. He is rude as well. Honestly just take the class as CSCC- you'll learn so much more and you can rest easy knowing "professor" Smith isn't taking your money

GO TO THE RECITATION. His weekly quizzes ask relatively the same questions he answers via a handout during his lectures. There are a lot of slides online and they are a pain to go through, but if you do both of these things you should be fine. He is also an incredibly helpful guy. Do not hesitate to go as him questions.
Marc is awesome. Anybody saying he is a bad teacher is absolutely wrong. His part of the class is not difficult if you put in the time!

This class is HORRIBLY taught for a foundations class. You meet once a week for 50 minutes, everything else is on you to learn.. he posts video lectures online but they take hours to watch. You as basically teaching yourself accounting in this class. The exams and weekly quizzes are extremely hard. Take this with someone else or at Columbus State.
Very tough class, but online lecture is important along with recitation.  Sometimes scary during recitation when he calls out random people to answer.

Course is tough. Be prepared to spend lots of time on the class. Marc is in charge of the recitation/lecture component of the course. Marc is a nice guy who is willing to help you understand the material. His part of the course isn't all that bad but the lab component of the course makes it near unbearable at times.

Really a good professor.  Very organized and clear with regards to the lectures and material.  It is not by any means an easy class, you will get a grade based on how much effort you put in, like any other class.  This class takes some extra work though.  Online lectures are awesome.  Labs are really not helpful, and just time consuming.

Worst professor I have ever had. No partial credit. You could spend weeks studying for his tests and still fail. He doesn't know how to teach under the semester system. He doesn't understand that it's an INTRO class. If you want to pass this class, you have to do well on labs and quizzes.My advice, take it at Columbus State if you can.

Marc is a fantastic teacher. He is great at clearing things up and is very enthusiastic. He clearly cares about students. This class is tough but if you attend all of the recitations and keep up with all of the practice problems and lecture videos you will be fine. No surprises.

Marc is very helpful and will make everything clear IF you go into recitation. He is also there at office hours to help you see what you need to get certain grades and will give you his honest opinions. He is always enthusiastic and this helps make class interesting. The class is very hard though and will require a lot of time outside of lectures.

Marc ROCKS! This class is a huge time commitment and you will need to spend HOURS per week on accounting in order to pass. But Marc gives you all the tools you need to do well, it's just how much you will put into the class. Do all the practice problems twice before each exam and you'll do just fine!

Marc is an excellent professor. He really helps you understand the material well. Yes, you do need to put time into the class to receive a high grade, but what class does not need time? Overall, one of my favorite professors here at OSU. He really made accounting interesting, and the reason why I switched majors after talking to him.

This class requires at LEAST 9 hours a week put aside working on watching all the online lectures and doing all the practice problems and online quiz. This is the only way to pass this class with an A. And with this, Marc is a really good teacher and delivers all the information very clearly. The key is to just contribute a lot of time to the class

Online only. Marc grades answers only not work. If you're off by a penny you're wrong. Too bad he doesn't care. Not there to teach. There to be bitter and fail you. Not a real teacher. Absolutely no help. Does provide big curve but he still doesn't care about helping his students succeed. I studied 15+ hrs a week and barely passed. Beware.

To pass you must go to tutoring. Learn all equations backwards and forwards. Tests will make you pally equations backwards. As in Marc teaches one thing then expects another come test time.. Tests are 75% of class. He does not grade work. Just right or wrong. If you're off by a dollar you're wrong. Doesn't care to help students. There to fail you.

Marc teaches you how to apply equations on way then come test time expects you to apply them another way. If you don't know all equations backwards and forwards and don't memorize every single word he speaks or puts online you will fail. Does not teach a single thing. Expects memorization. Pointless and waste of time. Memorizing gets you nothing.

Awful professor. Expects minimum 20 hours a week of studying considering the amount of work he loads online. Quizzes are clear with materials online but only account for 25% of grade. Exams are the other 75% and are nothing like quizzes. Will spend all of your free time with tutors and studying just to get by.. Not here to help you.

This class is extremely hard. The quizzes and practice problems are nothing like the exams. The exams are what makes this class hard. You can get by with quizzes but not by much. I recommend taking this class in the summer when you do not have a full load.

I liked Marc. He made all materials clear on modules online. 3 exams and 7 quizzes online. They weren't too bad as long as you do the problems prior the quizzes and exams. I managed to get an A on first two exams. I don't know why people would fail this class, it just requires a bit of time and energy.

EXTREMELY HARD course. Stay away from this professor. He does NOT grade your work, you are either right or wrong. He offers little to no help with tutors who are barely able to help with most of the problems he presents. spent many hours with tutors and still barely got by. Tests are near impossible to pass. Seriously find another professor. Beware

The best teacher at Fisher. You will learn the material. 3 midterms are all difficult. Just do all practice problems and quizzes to prepare. Labs are awful. Marc is a good guy and there are a lot of resources available to do well. Getting an A is near impossible though

Marc is by all means not an easy teacher. This class separates the men from the boys in the business school. You have to do all the non-mandatory homework to get a good grade. It is by far the hardest 3 hour course I've taken yet. Use the lab portion as a buffer to protect your grade

Marc is extremely helpful. His exams are tough but he gives you all of the material and resources needed to be successful. Not an easy A but it is possible with hard work. The labs are terrible but those have nothing to do with Marc. His portion of the class is awesome. You can't get a much clearer professor than Marc.

Acct 2200 is sort of tough, the class consists of both regular lecture and lab. The lab portion is annoying, and i did not get much out of it. Grading depends on T.A. However, the lecture portion was ok. Marc does a great job of teaching material, however, his testing is exponentially harder than what he goes over when he actually teaches you.

Nothing really new to add. Marc is a good teacher, but his tests are just a lot harder than the practice problems. If you don't want any B's to show up on your report card, then don't take this class because theres a good chance you'll get one. Labs and quizzes can help your grade but maybe not enough to get an A. Take at CBUS State.

His lecture videos are very clear and organized. Going to recitation is extremely helpful and he usually gives problems similar to ones on the quizzes. The tests are incredibly hard and much more difficult than the practice problems and quizzes. They do not prepare you for the difficultly of the tests. The labs can help your grade though.

AIS is Definitely the easiest class I've had Marc for. Typical Marc Smith class. Lectures are very structured and easy to follow. Just memorize your notes word for word that he writes on the board and study HW problems and you will do well. 2 midterms, final, and 3 quizes.  Should be an easy accounting class and it is.

Hes the most terrible professor I ever have. The exam is super difficult, is not as the same easiness as the practice assignments. He WILL DESTROY your GPA, i recommend taking this accounting class in another school! I hate this class.

He is very funny during recitation, but he is such a bad ass after class. most people can not get a good grade, not just because the course is difficult, one of the main reasons is the online lecture is so slow and boring. the quizs and exams are way too difficult. the worst thing is the lab which takes your much time to finish.

This was my third class with Marc. As always, he's extremely clear and you can't NOT learn the material if you pay close attention. No need to use the text, as he writes his own notes (which are very helpful for studying). Re-work quiz and example problems as much as possible.  Pretty work-intensive class, but he gives a huge curve.

AMIS 310 with Marc Smith was definitely a bit of a grind. The online lectures are great because you can pause and rewind the videos when you're trying to really soak-up info. Quizzes can be printed out and worked on throughout the course of the week. Exams are definitely tough, but very manageable if you complete all the practice problems/exams.

WARNING! This is a mostly online class! The online lectures are painfully slow. Not hard though if you can wade through the info and have time to practice. Taking the exams backward is good advice, as mentioned elsewhere.

When I went to the first class--the last of my 20-hr schedule--I thought I was going to drop it, as the other classes were going to keep me very busy.  I listened to his first lecture and was blown away.  Outstanding teacher! Thorough understanding of the subject, clearly conveyed.  You'll need to know the material dead cold to get an A.  STUDY!

Open ended problems at the end of each exam can be very tricky. Most of the time they aren't covered at all in the quizzes or lecture slides. If you put in the effort, however,(and yes it will take a massive amount) you can get an A. In both 211 and 212 my lab grade brought me down from an A to a B+, so pray that you get a good group.

class is rough, but if U keep up(watch online leactures B4 every fri, do HW, go to Fri lecture) U should do fine. On average, quizzes that are online take about 30-45 minutes(which depends on how well prepared U are). Exams are are tough, so study well in advance. Watch your time b/c thats what hurts students on exams. there was a nice curve @ end.

exams can be hard! prepare at least a week in advance. Helpful hint:work backwards on the exams! the last 10-15 questions are fill in blanks that are worth 10-15pts each. the bad thing is, its either all or nothing.no paritial credit given. the first 30 questions are multiple choice so you can guess if your short on time. go to fri lect & good luck

Good online teacher.Slides book helps a lot.Keep on track with hw.Take your time on quizzes thats where it will get you.All or nothing point on both quiz and midterms.Dont have to show work on either.No tb.Study lots for the midterms and do the practice problems.

VERY hard to get an A. Words of advice: Study A LOT for 1st Midterm and Final, they are both a lot harder than 2nd Midterm. Go to Terri for help on labs, LAB TUTORS ARE WORTHLESS! The structure of this class is awful and unfair, but unavoidable. If you work as hard as you can, expect an A- or B+, and don't be upset or surprised if you get a B.

Great teacher. He is very clear and organized. Gives great notes. The class (211) is a hard class. The tests themselves are hard. The group projects in labs are all but impossible with no lenience for anyone.
The best professor at Ohio State. He is crystal clear and sorta entertaining. The tests are hard though, especially in 212. Do all the practice exams! Go to the tutor labs!

Best teacher I have had a Ohio State. He is funny, nice, helpful...everything a teacher should be. Many kids complain about how hard 211 and 212 are but if you go tho his lectures and do his practice problems you will get an A.

While the material is not hard, it is VERY hard to get an A. Marc is a good, clear prof, but no partial credit on exams kills students' grades. Not to mention the dumb points lost in lab due to formatting errors. Class is not curved. Expect to work hard to learn rather easy material, and still get at best an A- to B+.

No doubt he teaches really well and the course work is not actually that hard. HOWEVER, this guy has some ULTRA HIGH expectations from students. He grades EXTREMELY hard and his exams are beyond comprehension. Take at your own risk, if GPA doesn't matter to you, which I doubt

If you actually follow the online lectures it's pretty easy to grasp all the material. However, it's a really basic class and Smith won't help you if you want to learn more. And if you ever try to prove him wrong, he's too full of himself to listen to anyone else's opinion.

BY FAR the best accounting professor OSU has to offer. This is not and should not be an easy class, but Marc makes it doable. If you want an easy A try a different class. If you want to learn something and be challenged then give him a try. I wish he taught every acct class at fisher... although its starting to seem like he does. MARC IS THE MAN.

Before taking this class, you should decide what you want out of it.  If you are going for the easiest "A", do not take this class. If you are willing to humble yourself and risk an A- B+, you will learn a wealth of knowledge from this man.  He is the best accounting professor at Fisher.  He will challenge you, put in the time and you will succeed.

There are certain people who shouldn't be teaching, and Marc Smith is one of them. He has a poor attitude when dealing with students and makes what should be an easy subject more difficult than is logical or necessary.

Great professor.  Completely clear with everything he does.  Do all the homework problems and sample exam problems and know them thoroughly, and you will do fine on the exams.  Your grade will be lowered by the completely irrelevant labs that Marc has nothing to do with.  Class would be completely fair if it was curved.
Do not take this class at osu. it is much easier at columbus state. i failed it at OSU and got an A at Columbus state
Crystal clear.  Labs are a joke-points will be taken off for the same things you were told to do the week before.  Material is not hard, but there is a lot of it.

Exams r hard esp. the final exam. if u know nothing about accounting, then this is a class u have to review all your notes and new notes daily in order to do well throughout the quarter & final.ALSO* U WILL TAKE A EXAM ON THE FIRST DAY OF ACT 212 OVER WHAT U LEARNED IN ACT 211...SO LEAVE THIS COURSE KNOWING THIS STUFF INSIDE OUT

Good teacher,Hard class. take this class at CSCC if your not specializing in Accounting. The quizzes are hard. The lectures are online so make sure you keep up and watch them B4 recitations. Take this class with two other classes that are easy. LABS ARE REALLY HARD, if you dont like math...Good luck with this class.

Albeit Marc is great at teaching accounting, but when it comes to the tests the practice problems and practice test do not even compare to what the actual test is. Marc is a great guy but this class needs to be restructured and not taken online.

I've never had a teacher, on any level, who is as genuinely excited and interested in teaching as Marc is. He lives to teach and is very understanding. He's an upstanding guy and will help you with anything you need, and I mean anything. This class is rough but having a professor as good as he is makes it much more tolerable.

Great Professor, highly recommend taking his class, probably best professor in the accounting department, accounting is hard and he understands and does everything in his power to teach accounting as best he can, go over the online lectures before quizzes and tests and you should be good
Crystal clear, great examples, and encourages thought. Id follow him to any accounting class he teaches

His portion of the class is completely manageable, even if his tests are a little difficult.  Gives online quizzes and a little extra credit at the end for a grade boost.  Lab portion sucks, get a good group or an easy TA or you are screwed.

Not an easy class by anyone's standards, but Marc is certainly the BEST accounting professor Fisher has to offer. This was my third time with him and it was another great experience. He'll know everyone's names and all the material will be laid out in an easy to understand manner. Attendance is MANDATORY though, as he writes everything on the board
I bet I'd like him a lot better if the lectures weren't all online!

Simply put, Marc is a great teacher. I would describe his teaching style as "No-BS"; he is very clear and there are never any surprises. He lets you know up front exactly what he expects, and he provides you with the tools to meet those expectations.  If you do poorly in his classes, it's your fault not his. Attendance and studying is a MUST.

he is a very good teacher with friday sections that help a lot with quizes and midterms.  This class can be hard but if you watch all the modules online and do the practice problems it is very managable.  Also try to get in a good group for the labs as it will boost your grade alot.

This was a very difficult class. I would highly recommend taking this class at another university. Marc Smith is a fairly good teacher. It is Ziegler the course condinator that makes the course material difficult. No need for the book.

Very smart, intelligent guy! His speech is extremely clear and he tries to interact with his students in the lecture. since Acct211 is a hard class everyone who wants to get a better grade should work hard.

Took this Summer 09. All notes posted on board, so attendance is mandatory to know what's going on.  The tests were memorization, so it was a relatively easy class, though there were some tricks. He seemed to really like teaching and was great at interacting with the students. He's the best accounting professor I've had so far, highly recommended.

He's a joke for 523.  Teaches like a robot.  Exams are minor variations of practice problems, a bit more complex but nothing challenging.  Asks questions that you'll probably never encounter in the real world, especially with regard to switching methods for Depreciation and Inventory.  Same goes for statutory rate changes on Deferred Income Taxes.

Material is difficult but if you watch all of the lectures (which is rough) and do the practice problems, it is possible to get an A. Seriously, study study is a must!!! You CANNOT glide through this one but his online lectures are clear as day and very easy to understand. The practice is up to you.

This class is not easy.  Exams are HARD so study way in advance and practice. GO TO THE FRIDAY REVIEWS!  He gives examples from the quizes and it helps a great deal.  Smith is a great professor. He truely wants to help everyone understand and gives you as many resources as possible.  I bought the Transcripts, and it was worth it.  Good Luck!

He is a good professor but this class is so dumb.  Its an accounting class thats online.  In my opinion that is just stupid. But Prof Smith is a good teacher even though you meet once a week for 2 hours to go over everything you have covered that week.

he's in charge of the exams and lectures. go to lecture, it is helpful and he'll answer questions. WATCH the online lectures. it's annoying but it's the best way to learn the material. book is unnecessary. exams are hard, be sure to study a lot...

Not an easy class, and it isn't meant to be an easy class. Unless you devote all of your time in a quarter to Acct 211, then expect a challenge. Smith is a good professor, but I am not a fan of watching 2-hour modules every week for 10 weeks. Overall, if you stay up with the work, and do the practice problems, you'll get at least a C

the class is not that hard if you are not lazy. If you dont like accounting this will be hell for you. I got 100% on both exams, it is do-able. If you are not willing to work, then just take the easy way out and go to columbus state

It's is (mainly) an online course.  I had trouble making myself do the material. It is nice being able to watch the presentation a couple times, but the tests are tricky and I was mainly held up by my group grade.  Luck into a good group or you're screwed.  Also DEFINITELY buy/print the notes immediately.  I only realized that halfway through.

Anyone who thinks this class is easy has an extensive background already in accounting. If you don't, some of the smartest business majors I know have taken it multiple times. Mark is nice and he tries, but its a distance course, and you teach yourself, CSCC offers the same equiv. in two courses..I was failing Mark's, made A's in their 2 courses

First, this class requires discipline. It is imperative that you (1) attend all lectures, (2) complete all practice problems, (3) complete online slides, and (4) ask for help. The class resources are impressive (daily tutor hours, office hrs) so take advantage. Curve is small; no partial exam credit. Tests are straightfoward but challenging.

I spent about 2 hrs a week on this class for the quizzes due Sunday evenings.  I studied the night before the exams and got an A.  Not hard if you keep up and stay organized.  Definitely attend the Friday classes.  Some of the questions on the tests are tricky, but overall not bad.  There's was about a 3% curve overall.
Worst professor I ever had. His class is horrible. Very time consuming class. Online lectures & quizzes. Exams and quizes are hard. Asks random & unrelavent questions. Avoid him is possible.

Best professor at OSU, hands down. I'd like to see any of you people who bash him take this class with any other professor. He explains things as clearly as humanly possible, and as long as you put in a little bit of effort, it's not hard to get an A. The material is not hard, it just requires practice.

AMAZING TEACHER! Fully explains everything clearly and concisely in his lecture modules online. Tests are HARD and very thorough! Do the homework (not mandatory), watch all the videos(not mandatory and watch whenever you want), and do the quizzes(mandatory) ahead of time! and you could get a B to B+ range. He was great the class sucks though.

Mark is kind of weird, but his section of the class (online lectures/quizzes/recitation) is very helpful. Class was not too hard, but very time consuming. Ziegler (not on ratemyproffessors atm), was horrible. She is on a power trip. A very 'fake' person. Represents everything that is wrong with business people. I hope I am never like her.

Lectures were all online, and I never watched a single one. Read the powerpoint slides and transcripts from the lectures instead and take notes at the same time. Take time with the weekly quizzes (2-3 hours) and then go over them so you can learn from your mistakes. Similarly, do the practice exams and redo ones you get wrong. It's not hard.

Go to class. Do the on-line modules and ALL practice problems! If you are having trouble, go to the tutor room. If possible, take this class with other less demanding courses or by itself during the summer because this class will dominate your time. Marc Smith is extremely approachable and helpful to students who show the effort. Curves at the end.

If you don't like or suck at math, don't take this course.  The material involves time to learn and practice.  Do the practice assignments.  Marc is very organized and willing to help, but only if you're willing to work as well.  I'm a science major and still this class was challengin for me.  Not unreasonable, but have to study the material.

First I have to say that I am an accounting major, so I have had my share of acct classes. Marc Smith is THE BEST acct professor at fisher hands down. He teaches so that anyone can understand it. 211 and 310 people stop bashing him, acct is just a hard subject he cant teach it any better. Exams are tough, but you know what to study, examples!!

First I have to say that I am an accounting major, and have had my share of accounting classes. Marc Smith is THE BEST accounting professor at fisher hands down. The subject matter is extremely hard, but he teaches it so well that anyone could understand. 211 and 310 people stop bashing him, its not him, accounting is just hard. practice examples!!

Minor class not supposed to give hard question, He is the worst question giver i ever have in my life, By far the most hardest class i ever taken in osu with the worst teacher like him ever, EVER! i almost failed!!!!
Good class.  Kinda boring, but well organized.  Definitely an easy B.

By far worst class taken at OSU...no reason exams should not have cheat sheets, if someone tells you this is easy they are lying! tudors are available if you can find time after the massive hours it takes you to teach yourself the information in the first place.

Seriously hard as hell,even he gives out the sample exam n the slides,yes i thought it was easy,well,the question on the exam doesn't have on the slides,thanks to this professor who cuts our 2 hour class in summer quarter,and i can't drop this class.Two days lecture become one day only? very good teacher huh? probably he needs holiday or just quit.

I do not know what people are talking about when they say this class is not that hard. I am a 5th year senior and have not had a class that took up as much time and effort, I barely passed on my 3rd attempt. No reason this class should only be offered online. Go to columbus state and take the 2 equivalent courses unless you have an interest in acct

Marc lays out the material with exceptional clarity. I do suggest doing the practice problems prior to taking each quiz as well as during the week of the exam. This approach not only makes the quizzes easier but also makes it much easier to recall the formulas and application of material when tested. Read all labs CAREFULLY and check repeatedly.

Marc is a very clear teacher.  He will call on students randomly in a 200 person rec. which is not always fun.  The tests in this class can be very tricky is you don't know EXACTLY what you are doing.  The labs are just there to buffer your grade so if you don't do well on those you're pretty much screwed.

Accounting requires ALOT of study time and effort to understand the topics. Smith is an excellent teacher, I highly recommend attending his lectures & watching every module online. Quizzes are all on Carmen, so you can do them with your friends and if you need help, the tutor room is great. Take this course with easy classes. It requires your time.

He is a great teacher who is very methodical and teaches the material in a very clear manner. The lab is the portion that really sucks, though. The labs seem disconnected from the actual class, and they just get in the way of studying the material that you will be graded on. Great prof though.

This class is not as difficult as everyone made it out to be. However, it is imperative that you complete the online practice problems independently and regularly. Remember, the course can be more appropriately labeled memorization and algebra. Practice, practice, practice and you will do well. Attend recitation, Marc is very clear and organized.

If equations had been allowed on tests, I would not have stressed out nearly as much.  This a minor course.  The minor Finance course allows a sheet of examples, which I think furthers learning of subject, not focusing on memorization.

Phenominal professor! Marc is great, he explains acct so well and gives you some good examples. hes very challanging, but hes an awesome teacher willing to help you. ask questions, he'll help. DO THE ONLINE PRACTICE PROBLEMS MORE THAN ONCE! i got 100% on first 2 test and 90% on final by working the problems over and over. Marc is a great teacher!

Extremely hard class.He is very good at teaching the material.  go to all recitations and do all homework.  He WILL call you out if he thinks you aren't paying attention or are sleeping, he truly loves being disliked i believe.

He was great.  It was a tough class I must admit, especially being nothing but online lectures with a once a week recitation.  He was very clear in his expectations however, and willing to help at all costs.  He is so organized it's scary.  I'll bet the guy folds his freakin' underwear!!

I could not think of a better professor to explain accounting as clear and structured as Marc does.  As stated below, this material is VERY difficult for some people to grasp.  Make sure to do all of the available homework and the class will go by much easier.

Here's a fun drinking game.  When you watch his online modules...because there is no actual class to go to, take a shot every time he says something twice.  You will be hammered in about twenty minutes.  I found exam one to be really easy, and I suppose if I had actually cared, but a LOT of time was wasted doing the lab portion the class (not opt.)

Lectures and quizzes were online, but if you stay on top of the chapters/modules every week, then you should do just fine.  I recommend doing all of the practice exams and extra practice problems available on Carmen. (A- without much effort)
Rough course to get through.  Used to get people out of the business college.  Alot of people drop the class and don't end up getting through it.

First, this class is very hard, i mean extremely hard, but not nearly as hard as it would have been with another professor.  He gets a bad rating from a lot of people unfairly because of the class material. Hes a good guy that is really helpful. The class is VERY hard, but he is a very good professor.

Excellent professor.  Fantastic organization of the course and materials.  This is a hard class that covers a lot of material.  It's a lot of work, but if you do everything he tells you to do, you will get a good grade.  You must have discipline to pass this class!  End up with a healthy curve b/c his tests are hard!  Learned a lot!

His lectures online and recitation was very helpful. He sometimes tends to get smart and doesn't even realize it. He definitely knows his stuff, though. His tests are very tricky. There is no curve because "class average is usually an 80%". It was actually a 73% and there was no curve at all. Remember, this is a weed-out class, that's why it's hard. GO TO TUTORING A LOT!

the man.. everyone that says hes hard, didn't study. ONe of the best professors I've had. You can be a total idiot and still understand from his lectures. Must attend lectures!!!!!!!  Tests are challenging.. like it should be, it's college.. no more kiddy classes                                                          JPK
Really boring, very unforgiving, but still better than Ziegler from what I understand. If only there were another 211 professor...

Hard class, good teacher. Save yourself $120 and skip the book--you don't need it. The material in the lectures is what you need to know. As long as you take some time to go through the lectures and WORK THE PRACTICE PROBLEMS, the class is a pretty straightforward A.
This class is extremely challenging, however if you watch all of the lectures and do all of the extra practice problems, you should do fine. Marc is really nice and always willing to help.

Download all of the lectures online, you'll never need to go to the once-a-week recitation lectures.   Do the homeworks (there aren't very many) and the quizzes, and you'll have little problem with the exams.    The class is curved, this quarter is was 85% = regular A

Marc is an awesome guy, he explains everything clearly and even though u didnt get a chance to read the online stuff, u stil can learn alot just by coming to the recitation. he made your first accounting class managable. quizzes could provide more chances though

Hard Class, Hard Tests, Make sure to do well in REC., and On group work it saved my life.  Smith is a great teacher, it's not his fault the class is so hard, he does his best, great one on one support if you make the effort to go see him. Practice, Practice, Practice.

The best prof. Ive had at fisher.  The material is hard because its advanced acct. but he does everything possible in class to make sure you leave with a good understanding.  You pretty much work examples from the book and his tests are very similar to the examples he gives in class.  I would highly reccomend.

First off, I wasn't a big fan of the online lectures although I'm pretty sure I taught myself how to do almost everything (material isnt very difficult). You really don't need to buy the book either as the class follows his slides almost exactly. I thought the tests were fairly easy but my labs were awful so just be careful there.

Okay granted this is a hard class, however, Marc makes it managable.  Marc, as always, lectures and spells out the notes for you.  He is the only accounting prof I have had that ever did this.  I wish I could take him for all my acct classes! TAKE HIM!

Exams are fairly difficult, make sure to do the practice problems, they are very helpful and similar to the exam questions.  Class is optional, he basically goes over the online modules in a condensed version.  Go to the tutor room to do online quiz's, tutors very helpful, got a 100% on every quiz.  Lab was the most difficult part.

You never miss a lecture when you get to do them on your own time.  He is very clear in the lectures and in recitation about exactly what you need to know for exams.  Class also has a lot of padding with the lab grade so you don't have to do amazing on the exams to get a good grade for the course.
online lectures are annoying to watch every week, but he is clear about the material. exams are easy to mess up.

Great teacher, difficult class, not because of the teacher, but the material.  Makes material very clear, repetitive at times, but you will understand.  Friday lectures are optional, same as online lectures, so pick one.  Labs are difficult and time consuming, but if you take your time they are easy points.  Good teacher!
Great Professor, very easy to follow and understand. His classes are interesting and he does a great job of making sure you understand the material

Overall the class wasn't bad, although it required a lot of work outside of class since lectures are online.  If you understand the first few weeks of material, the rest of the class is much easier.  I got sick of watching his face on the online lectures, but he explained stuff very clearly.

easy class. why does this guy talk like the way he does? does he think hes some kinda news announcer or something like that? he really likes attention. look at all the video lectures! instead of formula & concepts & stuff, we have to watch his close-up face for 2 hours/week.

I lovved this class. Marc explained it very well even though lectures are on line. Compare to Accounting 212, this class is so much more structured and easier to understand. No need to buy book, book is only for recitation and honetly i didn't even open it once!

The lectures on line are important; Make sure you do well on the weekly quiz because it can help your grade in the long run.  The class is tough; I thought I got it but the tests have tricks so when I thought I did well, I was returned a C.  The TA's help on the quizzes is worth your time.

Marc is a good professor.  You MUST watch the lectures that are on separate CDs.  Although they get redundant, they explain everything.  After the first test, which I did horrible on, I started watching the lecture CDs and got A's on everything else.  I only missed one question on the final, which is very odd for me.

avoid this man for Acct 627,. he doesn't really teach, he just repeats what's on the textbook,his exams are HARD, if you wanna take Acct 627 avoid this guy !!! but he's HOT, I think he's the hottest professor I've ever had in OSU

Like everyone said, redundant to the point of nauseum. WATCH THE LECTURES. You might as well burn the book for heat because it does you NO good. Review all lectures and take practice test before exam. Tough class and ridiculous that it is online. All business majors have to take this so just bear it for the 10 weeks and move on.

This guy is CLEAR.  To a ridiculous, possibly addiction related, extent.  Very ordered.  His lectures seem rehearsed, but are very helpful.  Prepare for quizzes as they attributed to my not-so-great grade.  He will throw some curveballs on the tests, but studying lecture notes is your best formula for success.  Would take class with him again.

His part of the course (the lectures and tests, not the labs) was very easy and straightforward as long as you viewed the lectures and did the practice problems given.  He explains things very well and the tests are not difficult as long as you prepare by a quick review of the lectures and problems.  Just be prepared to work even though it's online
He did a great job.  Course is tough and the labs suck, but Mr. Smith was outstanding with the online work.

Excellent Professor!!  To get a good grade: study the p.point slides before going to the lectures, then take the quiz after the lecture.  For midterms and final, study all the assigned chapters and just know the general concepts, and get familiar with the formulas.  Easy A if you are serious about this class.
Really good teacher.  The best accounting teacher that you can get at osu.
He explains things soo well
Ever seen The Producers? This man is the replica of the accuntant on it.  Hard class for an online format, I was not a fan. But you have to take it for business minor.  Good luck!
Hard class and should not be online. Only by the grace of God does he curve.

VERY clear and to the point of what you need to know to do well on the exams.  He will not lead you down various trails leaving you lost and having to do the work on your own like some other acct. teachers I have had.  Good man and a great teacher!  AVOID KRAZ IF POSSIBLE!!!!!!
No Comments

I can't believe no one gave him a "tamale" yet. One of the best teachers I have ever had.  I heard horror stories about this class but was not all that difficult.  DO NOT FALL BEHIND.  Online lectures were long and it got to the point where you get excited when he changes polo shirts, but overall, VERY good class! I LOVE MARC SMITH!!!!!!!
Good Prof... Midterms are hard... nothing like quizes he gives in class.... do homework you will be fine

Marc is a very cool teacher. Nontraditional i guess. Very concerned on making sure you have the concepts of the class down. He's laid back and very approachable. I asked him about my grades and he was able to e-mail me them...a couple days later, but otherwise well organized. His notes may not be his, but he does a good job at lecturing.

Great professor.  One of the best I have had at ohio state.  Really taught the material well on online lectures.  This class should be offered in a classroom instead of just online because there is a lot of material and hard to follow, but he does a great job teaching.  2 midterms, a final, and quizzes every week.  A VERY CHALLENGING COURSE!
not a bad prof, prolly the best possible for the acct 211 class at OSU

Tough class.  Smith is a little rough around the edges but one-on-one he's really nice and helpful. Make sure to go talk to him during the quarter. I did and he gave me some suggestions that allowed me to really improve my grades. Overall one of the better classes I've taken at OSU and I've been here for 4 years.
He does a very good job with this tough class. Everyone says how much better this class is now than what it used to be.  Overall a very solid prof.

The online lectures were slow and boring if you are already taking 20 hours finding another 3 on top of that to watch the lectures is difficult. Had it been in a lecture hall it might have been easier to deal with but having to make time and watch it on a computer just sucks. The class is hard and the Lab groups even worse. Good luck though.

OK, first off, scheduling is coming up for sophomores to be and if you have to take 211 or 310, TRUST ME, TAKE HIM.  Best professor at i've had so far.  If you are one of the people complaining about him, you prolly are taking 310 and don't know anything to begin with and if not, you simply are trying to place your own blame on someone else.

I can safely say I hate Marc's online lectures. I feel I don't retain information, and his slow speech, and unfunny, quirky remarks do nothing but make me want to shove my pencil in my eye, rather than take notes. If this class was taught in a lecture hall, it might be more reasonable but I can't justify the time required for so little gained.
He made me love accounting and I wish i could have him for the rest of my acct classes.
OBNOXIOUS!

Awesome class structure.  He posted video and audio of all his lectures as well as a transcript of all of them, including slides and comments he makes.  All I did was go through the transcript and took notes and I got an A.  Very cool guy too.
No Comments

The class pretty much sucks, but u have to take it. He talks about him self a lot, even in the online lectures. You probably will wanna throw your speakers out the window by the end of the class. Had a couple run ins with him and he wasn't really nice. He kinda makes you feel stupid for asking questions.

He knows the material well, but the class in general sucks.  Ohio state doesn't seem to care about whether or not its students actually learn and can apply the material.  And sometimes the TA's are wrong, so make sure you reference the book.
My favorite teacher so far at OSU.  He's really funny and explains things clearly in a wau that its easy to understand.  His online modules are great.  Definitely recoomend this instructor.

Cool guy very nice and approachable but teaching isnt meant for him. Hes terrible with giving back grades or really doing anything on time. we had a midterm the last day of class and then had a final four days after that. never responds to emails and misplaces some grades.

I TOTALLY DISAGREE! Marc was a cool person, yes,  but his class sucks. He doesn't give you back grades so you have no clue how you are doing in the class. He doesnt answer emails or respond to web CT. Lecture is all over the place and he doesnt even write his own notes or test. Awful.

Marc Nathan Smith is one of the coolest teachers you will ever have. His phonetics class was so funny b/c he makes all these crazy sounds from languages (his Hindi impression is hilarious). He goes over the material and answers everyone's questions very well. you can get to know him outside of class too (80s night at Skullys!) awesome teacher
everyone said his tests were really hard, but truthfully, if you know the material, you'll get a 100% on the test.  If you fail this class, you are either not doing the work, or simply retarded.
No Comments

Horrible!! The only way you can get a business minor is if you take his online course (at least when I took it, that was it) - completely hideous and boring.  After staring at his face online for hours and hours each week I wanted to shoot myself.  This is the only class I had to take over ever in college.
This is a tough class. You have to be on your toes for this one. Smith is a tough, yet solid prof.
What a great prof! Everything was extremely clear and you always knew what to expect from him. I don't know of many profs that can make accounting enjoyable; Marc certainly does that!
He was very enthusiastic and knew his material well. His Quizzes and Midterms/Finals were challenging though.

He is a good teacher, he gives lots of examples in which he gets the class involved so people can understand and learn from other mistakes. However, his exams are a little difficult because every acct. mistake you can make he has a mulitple choice answer for. So you think you get it right, but you really don't. Over all great teacher!!

Impossible...(take accting at Columbus state; guarenteed A's)!  This is an online class--with an optional class on Friday (optional book as well).  Quizzes are taken online and are really hard, he drops 2 though.  Exams are hard and all multiple choice, but throws a lot of tricky questions in there. Good Luck.
unbelievable helpful;clarity is excellent;great guy;easily the best teacher i have ever had

He is the best professor i've had at OSU!!!! He made me like accounting.  This guy is amazing.  I hope OSU gives him the  money he deserves.  I don't care what this guy's teaching. Whatever it is I'm sure he'll do it better than most people.  TAke his class don't be afraid
Had him for 522 and auditing.  He was fantastic in both.  Truly enjoys teaching and holds your attention well in class.  Very fair.  I owe him a debt of gratitude for sticking with accounting.

Straight up, Marc has some of the hardest tests ever. However, if you go to class and put forth the effort you should do fine. Class was always fun and the dry sense of humor was great. Best prof yet. Take this guy.

Very clear in lecture, not boring! Genuinely wanted to help students learn. The textbook was awful, but the online lectures were helpful and the in-class recitations were indispensable. Often, I went to the recitation instead of watching the online lectures.

I was terrified of the online format of this class but loved it. It forced to keep up. Marc is awesome, gives you every option of how to do the lectures and offers optional reviews once a week(no mandatory class time) Very fair tests, straight forward lectures. If you keep up it will be fairly easy.

Awesome.  Most enthusiastic Prof out there.  Good at answering any questions. Clear formulas and defintions.  Go to class and follow his notes for the exams.  Reminds me of Corky Remano in a good way.
Great teacher.  Last class before graduation.  Helpful. Just ask questions and keep up with the material and you'll be just fine.  Online courses usually scare me, but this one moves smoothly.

Although this was a computer-based class, I still made attempts to attend some of his optional lectures where he clarified homework/quiz materials. As a non-Acct/Biz student, I managed to understand most of his VERY comprehensive materials. Very clear and straight-forward lectures and slides.
Best professor I have had at OSU!  I absolutely loved coming to class.  You will never be bored.  Get this guy if at all possible!  He is very fair too which is nice to see in a prof.
Great prof!  Really explains things well and is very entertaining in class.  I strongly recommend him for this class to all students!
very good instructor. always will to teach. the easiness of the class is the result of brief explanation of the material

Marc is an amazing teacher.He actually teaches the material with out putting you to sleep. He is very concerned with making sure everyone understands.  His tests accuratly depict what he has taught in class. Class Average: 75% Impressive =)

He' SO adorable; and really loud; his lecture is very organized and straight forward; he won't torture you over b/s in the book; he just teaches you what you need to know; take him; avg test grade = 70%(in our class), usual curve is about 3%: 90% for an A
Good prof, online lectures went too slow, but thats good for business students. Just download the PDF files the night before the exam and you'll be money.
AWESOME!!  Best class & teacher at OSU and this is an online course!!  Marc is great and he doesn't take any crap from whiny students.  Highly recommend!!
Good sense of humor.....makes the class fun!

Man, this guy needs some ritalin. He doesnt stop moving the whole lecture and his little sayings make me question the value of my life. He is a bit unorganized, and for not having to teach at a class, could be a little more on top of the ball.
marc did a great job.....a teacher that actually cares.  one of the best teachers i have had.
great teacher! energetic! have a jim dandy of a weekend! and remember that assets ALWAYS equal liabilities and equity!!
Excellent instructor, one of the best in AMIS!  His classes made me want to keep on coming back!This guy is certainly worth taking!
Very nice Professor. He works hard to try to get you to understand. Accounting is just a very very hard subject to grab a hold of...
No Comments
Good teacher did his best with accounting. Funny, nice, easy to understand.
Very interested in student's learning material. Best Prof I had at FCOB.
TRIED to make acct fun & easy. Overall good teacher
very energetic and funny for accounting

She is an extremely nice woman who cares deeply for her students. The class is tough because of the material and I think she is better than most of the other cost teachers. Her class is disorganized and hard to follow sometimes because she jumps around. I did really bad on the midterm but studied hard and was able to get an A

I have mixed feelings about this professor. The class is a lot of group work which isn't bad if you have a good group. She talks the entire semester about giving all these bonus points at the end, but then doesn't follow through. Her final was so much harder than her midterm and her so called "curve" ended up being 1%.
Prof Turner cares a lot about making sure the class understands the material. If the class seems behind pace she will adjust due dates accordingly.

Very disorganized class, she gets off topic very easily. Doesn't use PowerPoint just teaches with problems so it is hard to understand the concepts. Nice lady, just not a great professor. Exams are 60% of your grade and there is a lot of group work. Really slow grader so half of the time you don't know what your grade is.

Awful professor. If you have a chnace to take it with literally anyone else, do it. Her lectures are confusing to understand, and the practice questions are nothing like her exam questions. She is not organized, very unclear in instructions, and gets off topic all of the time.
Dr. Turner is a really fun professor and she cares a lot about her students. She is pretty dry but her class is straightforward and it's easy to know what the exams will be on.

Terrible class. Do not take with Turner. Her exams are impossible and she does not teach. Only a midterm and a final. Lecture notes and homework nothing like the final. Her notes are all over the place and she is such a slow grader. Gets off topic all the time.

Dr. T is a dry lecturer but the material in this course is pretty straightforward. She requires the textbook but you could probably do well in the class without it, I didn't really read it. She wants to help you so if you have questions, she is receptive to them. 70% of the course is two exams and there are group quizzes and one group project.

Shes a super nice lady and is very understanding if you need to miss class or need extra time on a deadline, however this was the most unorganized class Ive taken at Ohio State. Extremely slow with grading, she doesnt use powerpoints so you dont have much notes to go off of, she doesnt use the book,& gets extremely sidetracked during lectures
Definitely hands down the slowest grader I've ever experienced. Pretty interesting in lecture and tests have a lot of minuscule details but are relatively fair.

Really like Dr. Turner as a professor and enjoyed her lectures. Not a hard class but it was a bit unorganized. Homework, review materials were often not posted until 24 hours before due date/exam. Grading criteria not very clear. Slides don't always follow lecture content. Take notes on what she says since that stuff will be on the exam.

Probably the best pick for cost. Turner makes a dry class more interesting by incorporating her knowledge and experience into the course. Enjoyed her lectures. A lot of small easy assignments and two fairly difficult exams. Slow posting assignments and grades. Need to practice a lot and know the material as the test questions are specific.

Professor Cynthia is very nice and helpful person, very knowledgeable in the subject and brings in a lot of real world experience and inject it into the lecture, helps you to succeed, and very approachable. enjoyed her class and recommend her 100%
Cynthia is very nice but her lectures are super boring. All of the homework and such is graded very lightly

She has a tendency to go on tangents. Overall, she's a nice person and it's worth your time to visit her in office hours. The tests ranged from an 86% average to a 68% average, so don't let an easy test fool you.

Professor Young is one of, if not the best, professor I have ever had. His classes are not always a cakewalk, but he is more than willing to take the time outside of class to help you understand the material. Participation is very important for this class. You are assigned homework between each class, but you have a partner you can work with.
PY the goat. - 3300H was not an option lol

Pointlessly difficult and tedious. I got good grades, read the textbook, actively participated, asked questions, etc. This class really isn't worth it if you're not an accounting/finance/econ major. His own understanding of a lot of these concepts is tenuous at best (case in point, when he struggles and stumbles over explaining linear regression)

The hardest class I've taken at OSU, but it was well worth the struggle because I felt that I understood accounting at a deeper level instead of just memorizing information for an exam. This class is brutally hard not for the faint of heart.

Incredibly difficult class, not something to take lightly. If you are committed, ready to study and bring your best thinking game, you will do well. If you try to mosey through this class, you'll fail or drop. Saw some smart students get crushed because they were unmotivated. Professor Young is a good guy, fair but strict. Top tier education.

Some materials are fairly interesting. However, the class has a heavy work load and tough exams. I spent at least 4-5 hours of prep before every class.   He is that kind of professor, who, after seeing terrible comments on his SEIs, unchecks "allow comments" box in his SEI settings the next year.  Brilliant.

Great professor. Makes you think and won't spell everything out for you in class. You have a partner to do homework with, which is great to bounce ideas off of and think things through. Definitely teaches you how to think analytically. Take the class and work hard.

He is really a helpful and knowledgable professor that you can learn a lot from his class. Even though everyone has to spend a lot of time on homework, he only cares about how much you learnt by doing homework. So it is ok you hand in a homework that you did really bad.

Truly not as bad as it is made out to be. You will spend A LOT of time on homework. Everyone struggles but you'll get more out of it than normal accounting. Whether you want to do the honors accounting program or not, this will help set you up for classes to come (331, 620 etc.) Can't get lower than a B.

The beginning of the class seems unbearable, but IT IS EXTREMELY WORTH IT.  The class gets better as you go along.  You will spend alot of time on homework and studying, but as you get more familiar with him and the class, it ends up being enjoyable (yet still a little stressful).  He is not nearly as bad as people say.

Rick Young's a nice guy, albeit intimidating at first. Be prepared to work 15+ hours a week on HW, reading and studying. Make sure you get a good partner the first day of class. This class is brutal. I think the book is intended to be used for graduate studies... so... yeah. Don't fall behind. Participate. The avg. grade is fairly lenient (A-).
If he likes you, you'll get an A. He may look at your tests before giving you a final grade, he may not.

A very challenging class, with very high level material.  However it was very rewarding with Prof Young, as he pushes students to think critically and problem-solve.  He has high expectations, and a lot of work must be done for each class.  Prof Young is extremely knowledgeable and passionate, overall a great instructor.
Not much to say besides avoid if you can unless you enjoy being lost in confused and then getting subtly insulted when you ask a question

Extremly difficult prof. Uses a book that is very hard to understand and he is not much help explaining it he is actually kind of a jerk if you don't know what's going on expects you to know everything that's going on and acts confused when ppl don't automatically know everthing from just reading the book. I would avoid him if you can
Professor Young is a great professor. He encourages you to think and he answers your questions. So as long as you work hard, you will learn a lot from this class and get a great grade in the end.

If you like to teach yourself from a book that "clarifies" difficult concepts by explaining them with variables like x1, x2 and x3, then take this class. Otherwise, AVOID. He isn't helpful and expects you to teach yourself everything. His tests are extremely difficult. I've learned a lot from difficult profs before, but nothing from him.

He might be ok for an honors student, but not for me. This is a non honors class but taught like an honors class. If you had someone besides Fellingham, don't take this.  Very different than the 212 I took with Mulchandani. I am going to end up dropping this class (I have never dropped a class before). I strongly recommend AGAINST him if possible.

He wasn't as bad as the comments made him out to be.  He might be a little snarky at times, but he's pretty cool. Make sure you stay on top of your homework, because you'll cover a lot of material over the quarter.

Great professor-His goal is to make you work as hard as possible, and he accomplishes it. Probably not for some, but I like knowing that I can survive a heavy workload. A lot more helpful than you'd  expect- he works harder than you at preparing for class. A bit quirky, but it's enjoyable. Recommended if ur not afraid of working hard. Not4slackers!
I don't get these reviews... I never did anything in this class, nor was I an accounting major, and got an easy A. It was much better than H212!
This professor is H-O-T!
This professor is more helpful than you might think at first.
Yes, he is qwite tough, but he teaches HONORS program, so, guys -- what did you expect?:) I don't say he is perfect -- but he is ok, and he knows his subject :)
This professor is HARD... the exams are obscene... my butt still hurts from the final.
He may be the devil....I think I actually had nightmares where I met the devil and it was Rick Young, and he's pretty creepy
The man is on a power trip and enjoys watching students flounder with material.If you have a choice, get another prof! EXAMS were IMPOSSIBLE

This is the perfect accounting elective to take your senior year. The material overlaps with FAR cpa material which is great. There are some in class activities, quizzes online, but no exams which is great. His lectures are interesting and the class is awesome overall.

If you politically disagree with Mittendorf, count on class being a struggle and very unpleasant. I wrote a paper that took a middle of the road view rather than a leftist view and he railroaded my grade. Very frustrating.
Professor Mittendorf is a great professor who is passionate about the material and clearly cares about his students. Could not recommend him and his class enough!

Professor Mittendorf is one of the nicest professors at OSU, and was super passionate about nonprofit accounting. Definitely would recommend to anyone looking for a class that focuses on a specific area of accounting. Great class!
Terrible prof
Very disappointing. Probably one of the worst professors at Fisher, if not Ohio State.
Worst professor in Fisher. If you don't agree with his politics and write a paper slightly leaning opposite of his views, he will punish you with a poor grade.
Poor professor that doesnt care about his students
Wonderful teaching! will take again

All I can say is wow. As an honors accounting student who maintained As throughout their entire coursework, Professor Mittendorf has a very skewed image of a college course. He is very subjective in his grading and despite actively participating in class makes a full participation grade not attainable in his words. Very disappointing.

If you plan on taking the CPA Exam, definitely take this course as an elective! It has helped me a lot in studying. The grade consisted of attendance, 6 online quizzes, a group project, and a take home final. If you go to class it is very likely you will get an A. Class was very lecture heavy, but Brian made the lectures interesting and engaging.
GREAT!!! awesome teacher tbh tbh hes grate bc he helps!!! All as and bs duh!!! Bryan remind me of family guy tf awesome!!!

Final project is the hardest thing in this class. Professor released details about the project more than a month before the deadline to give you sufficient time to work on it. If you choose to wait till last second, then dont blame on him for the bad grade you get.
Ridiculous class that is completely subjective. Most of us thought we were doing well until the final grades were posted and then there was a Huge discrepancy. Worst class I've taken at OSU.
Incredibly poor class that frustrated many of the students in the class this semester. Very surprised, as I was looking forward to this class.
This class leaves a lot to be desired. I wish I would have taken Tax II instead.
If you're a strong student and expect to get an A, don't take Mittendorf. Several students have filed complaints regarding this class to Fisher.
Very poor class that lacks objectivity in grading and inconsistent expectations.

So the teacher take 2 or 1 points of everybody because he asked 2 pop up question and no one answered .  This pop up question was not even outlined in the syllabus or mentioned in class . So off a little % from the next grade level just because the teacher push everyone down by these points. Choose this class was intended to get A but really hurts
Great professor! Highly recommend taking 4220 as the accounting elective. Very easy class, yet you learn a lot.

Awesome teacher, I learned so much about the topics from him and his teaching style is great. Gives great information and always has relevant examples in class to help tie the material in to the real world.

Probably one of the most interesting accounting classes I took. Prof. Mittendorf keeps the class interesting and delivers the material in clear and understandable way. The coursework wasn't strenuous and the class definitely beats Tax II from what I've heard about Tax II.

He is one of the most engaging and organized professors I ever had at the mba program at OSU (course I took is mba6211) His lectures are clear, easy to follow, never boring, and very helpful at simplifying difficult concepts. I did not imagine I could sit in an online class for 3.5 hr straight but I did and time passed fast! highly recommend.

He's a nice guy, but not a fan of the way he taught. There's a disconnect between the lectures and textbook when it comes to both concepts and ways to solve the problems. Lecture slides aren't posted until after class, which is unhelpful for note-taking/working on in-class problems. If I could go back, I'd study the textbook more than the lectures.

His accounting class is pretty tough, I didn't think he was a great professor, I struggled on the first exam (overall the class did as well) and then found Preston of 405 Tutoring, use a tutor otherwise this class is really hard unless you eat/sleep/breathe accounting
Super nice professor! Defiantly would recommend!
He makes learning fun and is very engaging with his students.

The content of this course was difficult, but professor Easterday always brought a lot of energy into the classroom and was passionate about teaching the material. He has a lot of audit experience to help make lectures easier to get through. The exams were fairly difficult, but you can get at least a C on them if you attend lectures.

Professor Easterday is awesome. Accounting is difficult but he prepared a lot for this class. He also recorded the audio for the textbook so that we can listen to it. Professor Easterday provides many make-up points opportunities like in-class assignments; pre-class assignments. I enjoy attending Professor Easterday's Accounting class.
Start the prework ahead of time and really focus as its on the quizzes. Test questions come from book bank so do the study prep things. Not an easy class but teacher cares and curves accordingly

One of only professors at Fisher who actually cares about his students and yet still pushes us to be the best. Rest of Fisher staff not so much. He clearly is for the student and he had soo many good life lessons besides teaching this class. Lots of material. Do homework/keep up and you will be fine. Refreshing to see someone engage with students.

This class has a solid amount of material, but as long as you read the textbook and pay attention in the lecture. The tests are very similar in question style to the OneNote exercises that you do in class. There is a very fair 85% median curve for the 4 exams that make up the class. Some of the Pearson homework can be a bit tedious but not crazy.

Homeworks don't align with exam well, and he doesn't provide a practice exam/many helpful resources to prepare. Exam time is not enough. He moves very fast in lecture. His handwriting is very difficult to read when looking over problems we worked on in class.

AWFUL. not enough time for exam. grade is almost only from exams. He says to do mental reps of all the questions (how do you even do that? you wouldn't know if you're doing it right). Also gives horrible feedback and provides no resources for test prep. The hw, recitation, lecture problems he says he gives bc they might not be on the exam...

He literally says that he asks questions in the hw bc it WONT be on the exam or maybe it will. He doesn't give any resources to help people study/prep for exams. He is accessible but his exams are very long 28 questions in 1 hr and many of the problems are lengthy word problems. He says to do "mental reps" of all the problems in the book ...

The semester isn't even over yet and I already feel the need to recommend her to any accounting student. Prof. Glenn is such a lovely professor, she outlines exactly what will be on her exams and brings in guest speakers to give us a glimpse of various companies. She provides extra credit opportunities and always livens the mood. 10/10 professor!

Great professor and an amazing person. Explains material clearly and brings in guest speakers so we could learn more about the professional work side of accounting. Really cares about the students and exams were very similar to in-class problems. Talks about the CPA and prepares us for it as well which is very helpful. Highly recommend!

HIGHLY recommend Professor Glenn for Tax 2! She's very clear as to what goes in the exams and offers multiple extra credits. Breaks down each chapters into something easier to understand. Take her and you won't regret it. Extremely understandable if you can't make it to class, as long as you communicate to her. She's also very funny!

One of the best professors I had at Ohio State. Professor Glenn was amazing. She was funny and always had jokes when some of the tax conversations got dry. Exams were very fair and based on problems we did for homework and in class. Went out of her way to help prepare us for the CPA exams and expose us to what we will do after graduation.
JG! She's the goat. Very clear about what she's grading on and super willing to help students all the time.

Tax 2 is definitely a difficult class. Professor Glenn was a great professor and made the class more manageable, even in an online environment. She made it super clear what would and wouldn't be on the exams, and her review sessions were incredibly helpful for preparing for exams. I would totally recommend her for Tax 2!

I think this was her first or second year of teaching but she was an awesome professor. She was very clear about which topics she would be testing on during lectures and held a review session outside of class before every exam. Shes a little nerdy but shes so cute and really wants everyone to succeed. I highly recommend taking her class.

Professor Monsen is my favorite professor I have has so far at Fisher. His content is challenging, but he gives you the materials to succeed and lightens the somewhat dry material with jokes. I would take any class taught by him in the future.

Professor Monsen is easily the best professor I have had in Accounting at OSU. Explains things very clearly and breaks down concepts in a way students can understand. Yes, the class is test heavy (70%) but the exams are very fair. If you show up to class and take good notes you will get an A. Make sure you take Monsen if you want to do well in 3201
His class is challenging, but given that we are accounting major students, I think it is fair. His PowerPoint is easy to follow. Love this class.

This man clearly loves teaching accounting. He tries to make lectures engaging and if you have questions he is more than happy to meet with you during office hours. The written response part of the exams can be brutal sometimes however, he applies a large curve around 10%. I learned so much and I thought he taught pretty well.
Very kind and caring, and easily approachable outside of class. He uses a lot of dry humor which I really enjoyed that kept class interesting. He really cares about student success.

He communicates clearly and does it in a way that is engaging and entertaining. Although he made the class test heavy, he gives you all the tools you need to succeed. Learners should take his course, slackers beware.

Hands down best instructor I've had in Fisher. Keeps material relevant to real life, makes an effort to know his students, has an ability to explain things clearly, writes fair exams, and keeps class interesting and funny. Loved this class.

Hands down the best professor I've had here at Ohio State. Was really good at communicating difficult subject matter and setting up the course in a way that encouraged students to actually learn the material rather than memorizing it for tests.

Even though the material was difficult, Professor Monsen truly made the class effective and organized. I was impressed with his knowledge of the material, ability to answer any questions that were asked, the organizational structure of the class, and the fair exams. They were very difficult, but he gave all the tools to succeed if you worked hard.

The whole class struggled except some who the concepts came naturally to. Power points were not conducive to learning. Tests are heavily weighted so if you aren't a good test taker I'd recommend someone else. Class avg. on some exams was 65%. Lack of real world experience (3 yrs in practice).
Makes the class harder than it needs to be. Unable to think about broader concepts of education.

Brian is definitely one of the best accounting profs in Fisher. He's entertaining, very knowledgable, and gives you all the tools to succeed in his class.
