Yes, tests are worth 75% of your grade, but his tests are more than fair and he gives a lot of partial credit. If you don't do well in his class, it's because you did not put in the work.

Very boring lectures, endless amount of material all presented in the most confusing fashion. Needs to figure out how to teach and stop reading his powerpoints. No slack given on tests (note sheet, open book, anything). Yes the material is dry but teaching should not be, inspire your pupils.

Nice enough guy just bad at teaching. Constant power points are very bland and the lack of differentiation between problems confused nearly everyone. Tests are worth 75% this is ridiculous. No class should be over 50% test. I wish he realized how confused everyone is. He tests based on "mastery" not on the material. This is a trap avoid if you can.
Good guy, poor teacher. Just talks about his powerpoint never actually solves anything. Needs more structure and less heavy tests. Tests are weighted 75%. Not very good at explaining the material.

Prof. Monsen is a great guy. He's like a cool nerd because he's super into accounting, but he definitely knows how to explain things to the college-level student. His tests can be a bit unpredictable because he pulls questions from the CPA exam, but he curves the class pretty well so it balances out. Extra credit on tests is from lectures.

Professor Monsen did all I could have asked for out of a 3201 professor and more. He always showed us real-life financial statements so we saw how the material could be applied. He was always willing to help and was realistic about how difficult or easy material would be. Can't say enough good things!

Professor Monsen is the best professors in fisher. I took his 4490 and ACCT3201. He is really professional and genius. The most important is that he is caring and patient for every student. I was sick and doing surgery this semester so I did not study much for the class, but his class is the best. Best Professor ever!

There aren't enough nice words to describe Dr. Monsen! Extremely organized and delivers difficult material very well. His sense of humor and passion for accounting always kept me engaged during his lectures. The most difficult class I have taken so far in my college career, but definitely doable. Highly recommend Brian.
Really recommend professor Monsen! Awesome professional and professor. Its a hard class but he makes it better
Best professor ever!

Best professor ever. 10/10 would take again. Brian is very organized and delivers course material in an engaging way. I was always excited to attend his lecture. Understand the Connect problems and you will be fine for the exams. Brian was also always genuine and caring about his students and flexible with office hours.

Best 8 a.m. class ever. Very energetic and engaging professor. Brian puts a lot of effort into his lectures and teaches difficult concepts in a concise manner. Recommend doing the practice problems on CONNECT. Exam questions are similar to his examples on the slides and he gives partial credit on the workout problems. Generous curve at the end.

Dr. Gee is one of the best professors I've had at OSU. He cares a lot about his students and that they are able to learn from his class. I would recommend to take a class with him if you have the chance.

I would say it is not fair that attendance have 20% of all. I tried so hard and I got 94% of my final exam. However, my grade changes from 88.05% to 88.55% only. I am so disappointed. Just because I couldn't get a word in during class discussions, my attendance score is only 80%. So my final exam grade seems to be so meaningless.

Andrea Wiltrout is the best professor in the Fisher College of Business. She really cares about her students and it shows in the way she leads. Read the textbook before class and make a comprehensive cheat sheet for the exams. Put in an honest effort and you will do great! Engage in discussions and be open to share, it'll make participation fun!

Professor Wiltrout is a really engaging lecturer especially if you have some interest in law. Her class grade is majorly determined by the midterm and final. However, if you do the readings and pay attention in class they are not too bad. Additionally, she allows each student to have a cheat sheet so no worry about memorizing a lot of terms.
One of the best professors I have had at Ohio State, HIGHLY recommend!

Professor Wiltrout was a nice, knowledgable professor that had pretty solid lectures. Your grade is basically based all upon two exams, so the homework assignments don't do much for your grade. The exams weren't terrible, but definitely were not a cake walk. YOU MUST PARTICIPATE IN CLASS.

This professor is new to teaching Business Law but I highly recommend her. She cares about your participation but the topics are quite interesting and they often spark questions anyways. I did very well on the midterm and average on the final and somehow still ended with a B+.

Professor Wiltrout is a new professor who teaches BUSFIN3500. Wiltrout is enthuisastic and understanding. The class concepts in the class aren't extremely challenging but it can be a lot because most people aren't proficient in law. Attendance wasn't technically mandatory, but there was a grade for overall participation. I recommend taking her.

Prof. Wiltrout taught her first semester at OSU in Spring 23 and was exceptional; she was very engaged in lecture and tried to simplify tougher legal business concepts by being enthusiastic and making good examples during class; exams were no harder or easier than an average core class but you do get a cheat sheet during the exams; highly recommend

I have never had an issue with a Professor in my 4 years at Ohio State until I took a class with Marissa Nelson. She is extremely rude and condescending to students asking questions in class. She does not act as a Professor who wants her students to succeed. I strongly suggest looking elsewhere if you value feeling respected by your Professor.

Frequently changes the schedule and blames the students when there are conflicts. Will not curve exams if only one person gets 100%, regardless of the actual average. Does not prepare students for exams very well. Practice is solved differently than taught in class. Lectures are okay.

She was by far the worst professor I have ever taken a class with in my entire life.I did not learn a single thing from her during class time and had to teach myself everything. In addition to being a bad professor she is also extremely rude and flat out mean! I would avoid taking any classes with her at all costs. Don't subject yourself to her.

She always asked if we had questions over anything during lecture. Class had a few group tax projects (which are easy if you make sure to follow the instructions) and open-note exams. Content could sometimes be a bit dry, but Marissa was great and we usually got out a little early. I'd definitely recommend her for this class.

Prof. Nelson was very personable and was willing to answer any questions. There were several group projects, but you can work in class and she is willing to check answers, which essentially guarantees an A. Having a solid understanding how to do the projects and homework is key to doing well on her exams. Overall, a really great teacher!

I took tax 2 and financial 3 with her over the summer. Both classes are project based but she gives you plenty of time in class for you to ask questions and if you actively work you almost always get atleast an A on the projects. The exams/quizzes can be challenging but open note so just read and youll be good. She is super caring and a great prof

This class is difficult, but Professor Nelson is great at teaching. If you have a solid group for workpapers, they will never be a problem. The tests are exactly the same as the homework. Hard class but a great professor with no surprises.

Lectures were very boring and usually did not go over information that was needed for the test. The work papers were often helpful but hard. Tests were very hard and she did not give us an overview of what would be on there. Do not take financial 2 with her! she will not do you any favors
This class was definitely challenging, but Nelson would be willing to help after class hours.

Lecture notes were often not applicable to questions on the test. Often skipped examples during lecture that would help students for the tests. Rarely gave good study materials for exams so went into tests blind which caused bad test grades. Expected students to know a general overview for pop quizzes but took points off for small wording errors.

Decent for Financial 2. Class was unorganized and she changed the syllabus during the semester. I felt the best way to succeed was to not attend her lectures because the material she went over went too beyond what was tested. Watching her online module's and mastering the slides will help you succeed on the exams. The material can get difficult

She is a great professor and a kind person all around. The only downside is a lot of group projects (50% of your final grade). But she offers workshop days to work on the project in class and she offers support outside of class if you ask. She really wants everyone to succeed.
Worst accounting teacher I have ever seen. She can't explain things. And she gives us a 78 pages final projects, which is insane.

Ms. Nelson was one of my favorite teachers at OSU. I had her for Tax 1 and Tax 2 for the accounting major. She is very understanding and has a fun personality. You will need to read the textbook but her exams are very fair and offers a lot of help on the projects she gives. Highly recommend taking her class.

Here comes a real review. Truthfully not too bad, and lectures were not boring either. But I didnt like how the grading was set and I didnt feel thats fair. Pop quiz significant hurts the grade. The averages for exams were under 70 but she only curved 3%. Ended up with B+ but I was able to get 4 As with Marc Smith!
prof Nelson is pretty average instructor. Class is manageable if you put in the effort. Fair grader, funny professor, like someone youd want to hang with in the real world. Would take again
She was captivating and I had no problem paying attention in class. I usually doze off in earlier classes, but she did a really good job.
Tough but fair. Not the hardest class Ive taken but its not something you can glide through
She's what you expect from a college level teacher. You are gonna have to put in a good level of effort. Don't expect to not show up and do well, but she's fair.

If you're looking to just bum your way through class and expect her to be one of those professors to change your grade to an A at the last minute, she is not for you. I saw so many peers in this class expect this then get mad when she says no. You will work in her class, don't get me wrong. But she is always willing to help and cares deeply

Professor Nelson was amazing! It was truly an awesome experience having her as a professor. I enjoyed her time and was inspired by her work ethic and availability outside of class that it made me work harder. She was an amazing professor
Professor Nelson is new but a well respected professor. Her dedication to helping students is admirable and encouragement is key to students success. Her energy is contagious and her class is fun.
Professor Nelson is one of the best professors I had at OSU! She cares tremendously about her students and goes above and beyond to make sure they have a good understanding of the subject!

Worst professor I have had at Fisher, and I have a dual specialization in accounting and finance. The class is not that difficult, but you do have to do really well on a few things or you'll immediately drop into the B-/C+ range. She's not understanding of her students and expects a lot even though she couldn't do half this stuff herself. Avoid!!!!

Not very many grades in the class. Reads directly off of pre-made textbook PowerPoints and omits half of that information. Gives us tax projects that she can't even complete without the use of tax software, but expects us to complete them by hand. averages on the quizzes were D's/C's. Not many grades at all.

Did you know that Dr. Roulstone used to teach at the University of Chicago's Booth School of Business? If not, then you didn't take his class because that's all he talks about. Other than the non-stop Chicago reminiscing, class wasn't too bad and was pretty easy. Basically a repeat of undergrad intermediate financial except with Roulstone's book.
Best prof in Fisher! I will remember Kathy forever! Love Kathy❤️

Professor Wantuch was genuinely so amazing to have for this course. I hate exams but her exams are all based off of the slides. I remember seeing so many of the lecture problems on the exam, so study for the exams this way. My exam scores increased like 10% after changing to study for the exams this way.

Amazing professor. She makes hard content easy and managable to understand. It's not an easy class to get an A because there are exams that test on a lot of material. But is a class that if you genuinely try, you will do well. Amazing structure. Geninuely don't think I have learned so much peacefully.
Kathy is a great teacher! She does a really good job explaining tough material. She is by far the best accounting teacher I have had and probably;y one of the best teachers at this school.

I was worried coming into this class with a B+ in both intermediate financial classes, but Prof. Wantuch is SO good at explaining difficult concepts from the textbook into something cohesive. As long as you can do the homework, you will have no problem with the class. I wish I had her for my earlier accounting courses.

Such a well laid-out and organized class! So glad I took it with Professor Wantuch. Her lectures are clear, concise, and give you the exact information you need for the exams. She is very kind as well and clearly wants her students to succeed. I'd love to take another class with her.

Amazing professor. The grades for this class included a lot of participation and homework assignments. There was two exams a midterm and a final that counted for about 50% of the grade (25% each). Then about 10% was attendance and participation. The rest of the 40% was homework assignments. She was willing to help outside of class even over email.
Great professor, would take again in. heartbeat
Great professor. Tests are exactly what you think they are and she really breaks down the concepts. Wish I had her in my earlier classes

Highly recommend her for this class. She explains concepts very well and will be happy to meet with you to discuss any problems. Read the book, since the lecture notes are based on it. Tests are somewhat challenging but if you keep up with the lectures and re-do problems from lectures you'll be fine.

I learned so much from Professor Wantuch. Her lectures were so informational and her material was challenging but very achievable if you put in the time and effort. She is awesome if you really want to learn accounting. One of the best professors I have had!!
Great professor, explains things so well in class. Homework can be tough but you get multiple tries. Really feel like I learned so much in this class

One of my favorite professors at OSU. I took her in the Fall of 2020. Right now, I studying to take the FAR portion of the CPA Exam. All of her questions match what you'll see in the Becker FAR review. So many topics in this class are present on the FAR exam and study material. I highly recommend taking this class with her!
Best Accounting professor teaching 3200. Take her class if you can.

Definitely take Professor Wantuch whenever possible, she is the best accounting professor I have had at Ohio State. I took financial accounting 1 with her and she explained tough concepts really well and always looked our for her students. HW and participation are half of the grade, rest exams. She is the best!

She is one of the BEST professors I've ever had in Fisher. I have taken her financial accounting 1 and tax 2 and I love her every lecture. The handout is extremely useful and ppt is also clear. She transfers hard stuff to something easier to understand and master.

This is the best tip I can give you for her class: Any problem that you see in class/on the online homeworks will likely show up again *nearly word for word* on the exams. Keep detailed notes on exactly how she does the in class problems that she prints out for everyone and you will do great on the exams.
Very well organized professor with clear lectures, which makes it easy to do well in the class! I highly recommend Tax 2 with professor Wantuch, I personally think it is easier than Tax 1.

A real gem. Very responsive to emails. Very helpful in class. Lectures that actually make sense. Exam heavy, but what's on the lecture is tested. Solid experience. She has a bit of bravado in her ways but don't let that scare you. A real golden asset to the OSU Accounting dept. You'll have to work for the grade, but she's fair.

Kathy relies heavily on the textbook. The homework is from the book, the powerpoints use a lot of snapshots from the book, the exams are questions from the book. Study the BOOK. She curves each exam as you go, usually the curve is based on the results of the first exam. She is a nice lady, just doesn't have the experience to create her own material
Good attitude, responsive to emails, friendly, organized, and i would take her class again.

She is very responsive to emails and an overall great professor. Her power points are very clear and she teaches the material so that you understand. I would definitely choose her for a class again because she really helped me learn the material. There were 3 midterms and then a cumulative final and also online chapter quizzes.

DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS WITH PARTRIDGE. He doesn't give any exam review material, doesn't post any of his notes or lectures from class, and is not engaging at all. Do everything in your power to take this class with a different professor. One bad test and your grade is done for.

Clay was funny and sarcastic but definitely a difficult class. 75% of the grade is exams and each are 25 questions so if you get one wrong, that's one percent off your final grade. If you aren't a great exam taker, I wouldn't recommend taking him but he does a good job of teaching the material.

Do NOT take this professor. His exams are so hard and the averages are like Ds. His lectures are often confusing and he contradicts himself so many times. He's a weird teacher overall who thinks that going over exams are unnecessary. I learned more from the textbook than from him. (the textbook is optional but it saved my grade on the last exam)
If you need to take this course, plz take another professor.
"You can look over your exams, but if you do, I'm going to think differently of you."
So bad already. They just be hiring anyone at this point. Reads off slides and doesn't teach.

A lot of these reviews surprise me. She was always very kind and willing to help any student. Her grades are very fair, even the exams are fair and what you learn in class is what is actually on the exam.

Despite a lot of the reviews on here, I had a very positive experience with Dr. Feustel. There is a lot of content covered in the course, so although attendance wasn't mandatory, I'd highly encourage that you miss as few classes as possible. You will succeed if you go to class and do the practice problems - she doesn't trick students!
Take 4200 with anyone else

She is one of those professors who will engage with you a lot if you start discussions in class. Most of the people in class stay quiet and do not ask questions, which I believe leads to their demise in their grades.

She's very enthusiastic about the material, and knows it all like the back of her hand, but her lectures were disorganized. Start reading the textbook as early as you can because the lectures are not very helpful in understanding the material. Practice problems don't really prepare you for quiz. She can be a little intimidating in office hours.

Overall, is a good professor. Gives lots of info on the slides, so if you know that, and how to do the practice problems, you should be fine. I came in with previous knowledge in tax, so I'm not sure if my experience with her would've been different if I had not.

Tough class. However, Professor Feustel does care about her students learning and is supportive. Clearly very knowledgable on the areas that she teaches. Class is pretty well organized. Professor is quick to respond to emails and flexible in meeting outside of class for students. Put in the effort, ask questions and you'll be fine.

I have to say she is a poor instructor! Tax is hard, but her class was harder! Her powerpoint lecture was so unorganized!! She just read everything on the PowerPoint quickly. There were many many many quizzes and assignments you have to do. Tons of Connect assignments and T-assignment. Her exams were hard too! The worst class I have ever taken!

I've taken both 4200 and 3400 with Prof Feustel. She's so nice, and cares a lot about her students. Both of the classes are difficult but manageable. She's great about being available to meet on Zoom to answer questions! I would definitely recommend taking her classes!

Professor Feustel is awesome and really cares about her students!! She clearly loves the subject she teaches (tax). Lots of hw and assignments but that helps w your grade significantly.  The only thing would be that the PowerPoint is not the best. The phase out and the exception are not stated and you have to read the long textbook for them.
Professor Feustel is tough but fair. The material for 4200 is difficult, but she puts in the time to help students understand and attend to different people's learning styles

Course material is not very organized. I know Tax is a lot of information and random rules, but she would often say exceptions to rules and ramble on without writing anything down. Powerpoints are not very organized either. Reading is basically mandatory to do well in this class. Cheat sheets on every exam, and lots of homework/quizzes/assignments.
DO NOT TAKE ADVANCED FIN WITH HER. Ridiculous amount of homework, be prepared to teach yourself.
Extremely difficult class with a very different teaching style and use of book that doesn't help at all. Plus additional case work that eats up valuable class time and could be spent on other things

Advanced Financial was a hard class, but she gives you what you need to succeed. She's a really nice person and cares about her students & if we're really getting the material. I only read the textbook for sections I was confused on, otherwise it's not necessary. If you put in the effort to actually understand and not just memorize, you'll do well.
I think her class and especially her powerpoints were very unorganized. Yeah I know tax is hard, but jeez, she has to deliver the material better. If you look around, most of the class is lost.

Tax is definitely a tough class, and while her exams were very difficult and she doesn't technically "curve," she does allow you to earn up to 10 points back after every exam (essentially up to a 10% bonus) with some make-up problems. She really cares about her students and is always available to help.

Excessive amount of work and incredibly hard to get decent grade even while putting in hours of work in. She is always available to answer questions and is very helpful when you go in to office hours.

Go to class and actually pay attention, read the textbook, and do your homework. Exams are very fair and you get to bring 2 pages of notes to use. Be thorough in your notes. No curve, but we've gotten up to 10 bonus points per exam (100 pt exam). She is very nice and funny and made tax as enjoyable as possible! You just have to put in the effort.

The course is difficult enough, but she makes it even worse by being strict with grading and being largely unhelpful as a teacher. Explanations and examples of concepts are presented in a wildly unorganized fashion. No curves given for exams, either, even with a course-wide C- average. You'd be better off finding another professor for this class.

Poor instructor!!! She knows nothing about how to teach. Her lecture is so unorganized and without any logic. She is like just read the slides and will jump to the topic whatever students asked for, then she will forget what she was talking 1 minute ago. Worst class I have ever taken! She won't curve unless the average score of class is D

Poor instructor!!! She knows nothing about how to teach. Her lecture is so unorganized and without any logic. She is like just read the slides and will jump to the topic whatever students asked for, then she will forget what she was talking 1 minute ago. Worst class I have ever taken! She won't curve unless the average score of the class is D.
Hard class but you learn so much. She's amazing best teacher I've had so far at OSU.

Prof. Sletten is truly amazing- although this class is NOT for the weak. You need to study, put in the work, and pay attention. Her lectures and explanations are great you can tell she cares about her students. Go to office hours, get to know your TAs and expect this to be one of your hardest classes. But don't get discouraged, there's a curve :)

Professor Sletten is a great instructor. Despite the challenging nature of the course, her ability to explain complex material is exceptional. She breaks down concepts with clarity, providing examples that make the content accessible and engaging. She does drop 2 out of 5 quizzes.

content isn't for the faint of heart its a tough class but she definitely sets you up for success her lectures are pretty clear and concise and is willing to take the time to work with concepts you don't understand but be warned its definitely test heavy as they are worth a significant portion of your grade

Take Katie. When talking to other students who had Marc, I felt so lucky. The class is going to be somewhat difficult but Katie is extremely knowledgeable and helpful. Definitely agree that the homework was harder than what we learned but they are manageable. Tests are slightly harder than practice exams but not much. Didn't use the textbook once.

Accounting 1 is going to be a struggle for most students. If you are debating between her and Marc here are some things I liked about her class vs Marc's accounting 2. She does her lectures in person, no extra videos you have to watch. Her classes are a lot smaller so you can get a more personalized feel

Katie's class at first was difficult, but after the first exam you'll get the hang of it. Her class is so much better than Marc's class. She takes class time to explain topics throughly. and her exams are also so much easier because they are graded on your work as well as the correct answer. If you are debating between Katie and Marc, choose Katie!

I had Professor Lem for Accounting 1 in Fall of 2023. The material was hard to comprehend and you were often left with little to no guidance on what/how to study for the exams. Her exams are impossible as multiple choice was worth a lot of points. She would always throw something on there we never did in class making it hard to do well. Take Marc!

I can't lie. I did not enjoy having Katie. I am not sure if it was the material in general, but I just felt like the teaching wasn't great. Her slides are all right but often the homework was nothing like what you learned. The exams are rather long and multiple choice is worth far too many points. She is also a little intimidating, sadly.

This professor was excellent, providing clear and comprehensive class PPTs, and the review PPTs were also helpful. Despite the handwritten exams, effective review ensures high scores. The professor is approachable and offers valuable advice for problem-solving.

He asks us to purchase the textbook when it is available in Carmen for free. He doesn't like when you come in late. He is super subjective.The way he takes attendance is weird, you can miss all the classes and it will be fine as long as you happen to be there when there is a pop case you never know when. Overall, really bad experience.

Amazing person who is willing to help students out pretty much anytime outside of class. His exams are tough and can be confusing but he is the best professor to take this class. Willing to help out with non-class issues also.
Actually cares about his students. Helped me get a job. Down to earth guy.
Patrick Kielty is one of the best professors I have had at OSU! Highly reccomend taking him for Audit. Content is challenging but he breaks it down very very well.

Was a nice professor but I didn't like how the lectures were set up. He relies heavily on classroom participation and much of the lecture consists of students talking. I don't really like speaking in class and didn't end up learning much from lectures. I found the exam questions to be subjective sometimes and exams are 80% of your grade.

Amazing professor! He is willing to help outside of class that includes professional help as well. The grades were only 3 exams and one other assignment. He tells you what some questions will be on his exams. He cares greatly about his students. The lectures are not mandatory, but the content is very important.

Professor Kielty is a very intelligent professor who cares a great amount about his students success in and out of the class room. He is very accessible outside of class and willing to help his students with anything. Pretty funny, down to earth guy with an interesting story. Highly recommend. No complaints.

In 5 years, this is the best professor ive had at OSU. Caring, willing to help in personal matters, and tests are reflective of material covered in class. He is down to earth and more than anything else he is very fair.

I liked having Professor Kielty. I think it's clear that he cares about his students and wants to see them succeed. The class did seem a little disorganized at times, but I think that could have possibly been different if it wasn't online. I definitely recommend reading the chapters before lecture; that really helped me understand the lectures more

I think hes a really good choice for audit. I took his class online and I think he did a great job and was very engaging. Not exactly sure how it would be to take his class in person though. You can tell hes very knowledgeable and really cares about teaching his students. Very approachable.
Recommend taking the course, yes, but under a different professor with more experience
Professor Kielty's help during office hours was especially helpful in explaining concepts and lecture material.
Professor Kielty is a solid choice. He really cares and will go out of his way to help you during office hours.
Not bad, just not competitive with the other acct professors I've had at OSU. Took a while to respond to communications. Easy class, didn't feel I learned much.

Professor Kielty clearly knows a lot about the subject and understands it from a real-world public accounting perspective, which is so useful for audit. He is such a valuable resource if you go to this office hours and he keeps his classes light yet focused

When asked to explain difficult concepts, he didn't seem to know the ins and outs of the material and proved to be unhelpful. He will probably improve with a few more years under his belt, but right now, he teaches like any other university GTA. Does provide good notes! Don't feel I learned much from the class overall
Professor Kielty changed my life!!!! He inspired me to be a better person and to not be ashamed of my truth - I wish all professors were like him. He should get a raise.

Professor Hunter is indeed disorganized and forgets to do certain things. However, he is very understanding and is fair with due dates and will push them back if necessary . He is willing to help students and provides a lot of experience on the subject matter.

Literally the most disorganized professor, does not update anything and completely forgets to edit/review or even assign assignments. 
Awful to bear with.

You can tell that professor Hunter is very knowledgeable about the subject matter. However, he is very disorganized: he forgets to post quizzes in a timely manner and is late to grade. There were assignments and time consuming group projects that took over 2 months to grade even when he has claimed they will be graded by weeks end multiple times.
Content is easy and professor teaches well. However, he posts HW assignments a day before they are due and is very unorganized. These HW's are also very lengthy and sometimes takes hours to finish.

I took Tax I and Tax II with Hunter. He is incredibly knowledgable about tax, and uses his industry experience to help contextualize the class, which is inherently boring. He really cares about his students and will offer great professional/career advice. The canvas page is somewhat unorganized, just be present in class and you will be fine.

The content for this class is tough for sure. He would hold review sessions every time before an exam. He has a lot on his schedule so he might post the grades a bit late. However, he's always there to provide feedback or comments on your previous assignments and quizzes if you attend his office hour.

A great class where you can learn professional research skills in Accounting. Basically equivalent to ACCTMIS 6201, a graduate-level course. He cares about his students and is willing to help in any possible way.

LOVED this class! The class covers extremely useful material especially if you are going into audit. This was by far the most applicable class for a future CPA. There are some big difficult group projects but you learn A LOT! He brings in various people from big 4 firms and other companies who give very helpful advice and tell interesting stories.

Professor Hunter is a great professor who truly cares about his students. He went well out of his way to help students prepare for exams. He also provides points back for work on exams which definitely helps. He also does a very good job of explaining relatively complex topics in a way that is very easy to understand.

The worst professor I have ever had by far. Is awful at explaining concepts (once he told us the wrong answers for his own lecture slides and had to redo the lecture the next week). The material later on is super specific for an intro tax class. Despite completing his assigned readings that take hours and showing up to class I have learned nothing

I had his class Spring 2020, so the class was in person for about half and then was online. Prof Hunter is very nice and I think he genuinely enjoys teaching. He is extremely disorganized and it makes the class even more difficult. He had review sessions that were helpful, but usually his lectures were confusing and all over the place.

Lectures arent terrible however were more than 2/3 through the semester & he hasnt graded a single assignment other than auto grades by Carmen/The textbook his lectures arent dry but also are not helpful at all. He has posted assignments 12 hours before they are due on a Friday @12am. He thinks we abide by his schedule and doesnt care about us

Prof Hunter really cares about his students and wants you to get the most out of his class. He brings in real-world experience and examples, and gets partners from the Big 4 to come talk to the class. I got more out of this class than 99% of my other classes. Tied for my favorite prof with Brian Monsen. Highly recommend this class.

While he is a nice guy, he is extremely disorganized. He oftentimes posts assignments and quizzes well after he said he would and has not graded any assignments. Probably better for entirely in person classes, but even the hybrid class is frustrating because of his disorganization. Definitely not ideal for online classes

Super nice guy, always willing to go over quizzes with you during office hours and help you understand the material better and even give back extra points. Generally, hes pretty good about letting you know the material of the exam but some of his multiple choice and true/false questions are needlessly tricky so beware of that. Overall, great prof.

Professor Scott (Matthew) Hunter really cares about his students but is disorganized. He responds well to reminder emails and student checking in. He provides lots a review sessions for material but he doesn't always teach it well the first time. Overall, he is fair and gives a decent amount of extra credit and curves all exams.

The course is easy but it is not very fun. The class is very dry. Rob does a great job of helping keep the class interesting and wants students to learn. If you do your work in this class, you will be fine.

Lectures could be dry, but that was largely due to the content rather than Rob. He's a good guy, definitely knows his stuff and willing to chat. Gives multiple group assignments in-class and there's a couple of presentations. Class was like a mix of the Excel class and accounting/auditing, which was interesting.

Rob is amazing he actually revises the class material every semester based off the students feedback. His lectures are very engaging and he manages to make even the boring material fun and easy to understand. Hands down one of the best professors at Fisher.

Don't listen to the old ratings, the class is now called ACCTMIS3620 and Rob is such a gem at Fisher. Very easy going and generally as long as you come to lecture and do the weekly HW you should be more than great. Very easy and quick exams generally everyone gets done in 20-25 mins. Would definitely take again.

Professor Whittington has a lot of experience and professional wisdom to share with his students. That being said, the content of the course is incredibly dry which is not his fault. His class prepared me for certain situations in the workplace unrelated to information systems, which I am grateful for.

I had Rob in acctmis 3620 this semester- He's a very relatable guy who clearly put a lot of time into the format of the class and making lectures useful. Grading and exams were a little tough in some areas, but there are plenty of opportunities to earn points. I learned a lot from this class and his personal experience- highly recommend!
Avoid if you can. Instructions for assignments and group projects are not very clear. Cold calling professor. Honestly I just found the class to be very boring and also annoying to be in.

Inaccessible outside of class; Given I had it at 8am, lectures are incredibly boring to sit through, reads off slides verbatim with very little additional information/key details to remember; A couple group projects that are extensive for little point values; Would never recommend anyone to take his class; Normal A student, not a great experience.

The absolute worst professor. Randomly calls on students and makes them answer questions, grading is terrible. So incredibly picky when it comes to grading, you never know what he is expecting. Also a good amount of team presentations and if your group sucks your screwed. Coming from a normal A student, good luck trying to get an A in this class.

Prof. Sheneman's energy in class was great and she definitely knows her stuff. Lectures were well-paced and there were a few in-class team assignments that were good for solidifying knowledge. Rote memorization won't really help you learn the material; you have to understand how the topics actually work in order to do well on her exams.
The exams were extremely challenging, and the results didn't seem to reflect the effort I put in.
The exam content was not related to the sample questions and the exam was very difficult. CRAZY！！！

Professor Sheneman is one of the best professors I have had at Ohio State. Far and away one of the best at lecturing/teaching you material I have ever seen. That being said, her exams are hard and she is a strict grader on her papers.

Really good professor. Lectures are interesting because she's hilarious. She genuinely wants to help students. But participation is 15% of your grade, and she is not very lenient on grading that. If you're one who doesn't like to participate, you won't do well in this class. Exams are tough but fair, and there's NO curve.

Love Sheneman. Definitely the most entertaining professor at Fisher. If you get a chance to choose her for Audit you should. Wish I could have taken more than just the one class with her. Audit is hard, but she makes it decent through lectures and helpful exam study guides.

Don't take him for Cost Accounting. He is very nice, but his teaching style is tough and the class moves fast. You'll need to learn a lot outside of class, and the pace makes it hard to keep up. As a straight-A student, I struggled a lot, so if you're looking for an easier experience and a better shot at a good grade, choose another professor
I learned a great deal, would take him again!

Corona is mediocre at best. His lecture is dry and his teaching style is to ramble about the topic which is hard to follow. He assigns projects and doesn't even mention them to us and expects us to understand them along with other major assignments. Do not take unless you want to challenge yourself beyond belief.
Strict but caring professor.  Grades for exams were fair.
Easy class
Agree with the previous student about john. He looks like not but he does care about his students. Take his class!

Hemenway is the man - he just asks you to think for yourself and outside the box and your grade will be fine. We only had class maybe half of the time, the other classes were watching videos and participating in discussions online. Awesome class, easy a. Mulchandani sat in the back though so it may change soon - take it with john asap!

EXTREMELY EASY CLASS BUT HORRIBLE PROFESSOR.  HE IS RUDE, IMPOLITE AND EVERYTHING WAS JUST SO UNCLEARED.  GIVES YOU A D FOR PARTICIPATION AND ATTENDANCE EVEN THOUGH YOU SHOW UP EVERYDAY.  HE DOES NOT CARE ABOUT YOU.  ALTHOUGH HE IS VERY SMART, BUT HE IS PROBABLY THE WORST PROFESSOR EVER IN FISHER.

This is another classic example of Tenure gone wrong. Teaches you matrix multiplication and linear algebra, none of which are applicable in an entry-level accounting job. I'm an OSU alumnus typing this from my full time job and I can honestly say, make sure he knows your name and you'll pass. Survive and Advance.
Extremely tough class. Avoid if possible. If not for curve, entire class would fail

Fellingham is one of the nicest teachers you will come across at OSU. For those that struggle with tests, take him because participation is huge. He remembers those that add to the lectures at the end of the semester. Overall very genuine professor who wants to help all of his students. Fantastic class that you will get out of what you put into.
Very straightforward class; reading is probably required for an A, but he puts the entire book online because, well, he wrote it. Only one final. Great juggler, great professor.
Worst prof in Accounting department. Uninspiring lectures that are unrelated to industry application of accounting principles. Material irrelevant to any accounting career path. Avoid if possible.

Crazy smart professor.  This review is geared ONLY towards Honors Accounting.  He goes over a ton of material at a very fast pace but is very open to questions if you are confused and will happily slow down until you fully understand.  Very very nice guy and curves extremely fairly.  I got an A with a decent amount of effort.
So easy to get a A

Dr. Fellingham is extremely kind and intelligent w/an indirect sense of humor.  His lectures and notes are well organized.  Class is let out 30-45 minutes early.  Text book(s) not needed for this course, but his lecture notes can be accessed from his syllabus page.  Take him if you have the opportunity to do so.  He is an outstanding Professor!
One of my favor professors in Fisher. He is extremely smart and interesting with excellent teaching skills. His lecture notes are highly organized. Highly recommend.

This class is one big proof, and most of it is exemplified with computer software so you can't/(won't) do it on the exams.  Fellingham is very easy going and intelligent... he is hilarious (unknowingly, I think) with his stories, I've never learned so much history in an Acct class ha ha... take him for 523, SO EASY (and you will learn too)
Take this prof for 212 without a doubt. Good teacher and fair tests, just go to class and take notes

Had him Winter 2009. It's hard to study in this class because he provides no practice problems. He instructed us to take examples from our notes, change the numbers and try them! He said if we weren't sure if we had the right answer go to office hours! Never have I had a professor that made you make your own homework.

hated this professor and the class- talks about the hippocampus more than accounting. the final was ridiculous compared to the midterm. said the final was only comprehensive in that you build on the material yet threw q's on the final that were on the midterm. doesn't use carmen so you're in the dark on your grades, don't but txtbook! no curve
The class was easy. His notes are really weird; they don't make much sense. You need to go to class because both the midterm and final are similar to the problems done in class.
Absurd notes. Completely random comments sometimes. Absolutely no curve. The midterm was easy, but the final was super hard... Glad it is over

Professor Fellingham is useless, funny but useless. All we do in class is math problems and he doesn't explain them. The book is horrible, it is only used because his buddy wrote the book. The midterm is fair 100 people got a 100% on it, but because of the high midterm, he made the final tricky and not clear. He doesn't respond to emails.

Fellingham's lectures drove me nuts. He writes incredibly strange notes. Class was barely accounting; felt more like a math class than anything else. If you can stay awake during the lectures and do the homework problems, you can ace the class, but if you mess up one little answer on your exam it can mess up all of the other answers which stinks.

Fellingham is the man and clearly the best Accounting teacher I've had.  There is a HUGE curve at the end so don't drop the class if you do poorly on the first exam.  I got a D on my first test and still pulled a B overall.  You don't need the book, just make sure you go to lecture.  Every problem he does in class is basically what's on the test.

Take him for any AMIS class you can. His tests are exactly the same as the problems you do in lecture, just with different numbers. Starts every lecture w/ a review of the last lecture, and does new material for a few minutes, and lets you go early. Take him, he's the ideal amis professor.

Great teacher. Goes over everything in class, do not buy the book. Test are exactly what he does in class.  Each day he reviews what you did the class before for like 30 minutes and then learn something new for 45 minutes. You get out like a half hour early everyday. Would take him for any class.
fellingham is a stud for 212. does the hw problems for you in class. test problems are very similar to hw.  by far the best 212 professor.  juggles and does tricks and has funny stories. take him!

Great teacher for 525. I swear, the book is written in some foreign language that no one knows except him but he manages to translate it perfectly. The tests are really straightforward. Don't buy the book, but make sure you go to class and it's an easy A. One of the best accounting professors at OSU.

Wow. This class was incredibly easy. You simply need to know how to do the examples that he covers in lecture. Don't be intimidated by the fact that 2 exams make up your whole grade; An 85% is an A, not an A- or worse. The curve is enormous. Do not buy the book. Attend every class and take careful, clear notes and redo the examples several times.
sometimes lectures are a bit dry. however, fellingham is quite unpredictable and hilarious at times. a great guy, easy class- try a bit harder than the average person and you can pull off an A.

One of the best professors I've ever had. Great sense of humor- sometimes he'll be messing with you and you won't even realize it til later. Very helpful. Boils the information down into something understandable. Highly recommended.

Fellingham is a stud. He rides a Harley and wears motorcycle boots to class. I was clueless all the way up until the midterm because I didn't pay attention at all. His lectures are clear, he answers questions, and his tests are pretty easy. All you need to do is go over the lecture after class, understand all the notes, and you'll be golden.

I could not follow him at all. His lectures were confusing and did not seem to have any focus on topics/subjects.  Textbook selected for class was poor and made no since.  Poor textbook in combination with poor instruction made for an awful class.  Highly recommend another teacher for this class.

Exams are short but hard. Final seemed to be really hard for most. study the examples. curved like crazy, i can only assume after not doing so well on the first midterm, well of the final but still somehow got an a.

definitely an awesome professor...go to class, follow the examples, study those same examples for class and you'll do fine. subtle sense of humor makes class hilarious. he's also extremely smart. overall, really glad i had him

I really felt lost in this class.  The professor knew what he was talking about, but failed to effectively convey the information. He'd sometimes go off on a tangent about barcode numbers or something, which I found to be completely uninteresting and irrelevant.  I wish he'd focused more on the basics, instead of spending a ton of time on matrices.
Brilliant man, and very interesting. Has a very subtle sense of humor, and is funny as hell if you pay attention. Don't get too comfortable; you'll be out of class at least half an hour early.

Tells you exactly what to study, which makes it so you only have to study two hours the entire quarter to get an A.  He also lets everyone out of class at least 30 mins early every class.  Tries to make the material as interesting as possible.
Eric Spires is the best Professor I've ever had at Ohio State.

Great professor. Very few readings, nearly all of the necessary information comes from the in class lectures. His lectures are very interesting and easy to follow. He writes all of his notes on the board instead of using PowerPoint, so note taking in class is a must. You'll learn a lot in his class, but won't have an overwhelming amount of work.
Spires is a great professor. He's very smart and a little humorous.

Great professor, has a different teaching style but that is easy to get used to. He teaches the material very well and has an extensive knowledge of auditing. Just participate, study before the quizzes, and be prepared and it is more than possible to get an A.

He's generally interesting and engages students. The quizzes can be tricky sometimes, but the homework/cases are graded based on completion. He's always willing to answer questions and go more in depth.

Great Teacher. Class format is very discussion based which leads to somewhat erratic note taking, but if you pay attention and participate you'll learn the material. Quizzes can be a little tricky but certainly not unfair. Overall, one of my favorite professors at OSU - highly recommend

He's OK.  He takes the time to answer questions in class. Quizzes are tricky, but they are meant to help understand the material.  Audit is a difficult course to understand without hands on experience, and the cases help in this manner. It seems that those who scored higher may have had intern experience.

Great guy and professor. Very easy grader on cases and articles which take no time Quizes can be tricky and the only test was the final.He really cares about you and seems to love teaching. His lecture and note style takes some getting used to though. You will find yourself randomly laughing in class. Go to class and participate! Highly recommend.

Prof. Spires looks very intelligent and understanding, and he is. He knows how to create a positive learning environment for his students to learn and discuss. He also has a sense of humor that often made me laugh unknowingly.
If you don't take his class, you will regret for that!

Great professor, highly recommended for Audit.  He is very clear on everything, and will often go into deep detail and give great examples.  Don't bother with the book as long as you go to class though.  Tests/quizzes can have some tricky questions, but he's just testing your knowledge, not trying to trick you on purpose.

Prof. Spires was fantastic.  The cases and articles were well chosen.  Quizzes and exams weren't very difficult.  Textbook isn't necessary, but it helped on clarifying some topics we didn't discuss thoroughly in class.  He's great if you talk to him in office hours.  Highly recommended!

Great professor.  Easy to understand and very helpful.  You don't need the book, as everything on the tests is covered in class.  He relies more on understanding the material than memorizing it.  Highly recommended.

The best accounting teacher I've had at OSU.  This guy really cares about his students and really cares about what he teaches.  Tests aren't bad, homeworks are easy as long as you turn them in.  Class participation can make or break your grade.  I would highly recommend taking Prof Spires for Audit.  Great teacher
One of my favorite accounting professors.  Class participation can really help your grade.
Class is really interesting, participation is KEY because he grades the exams hard. Really personable though, overall good prof.
Great lecturer, interesting to listen to.  Really excited by what he teaches, if you can believe that (it's accounting).

Even though the curve on this class is huge, the exam is extremely hard. The question on exam is not even close to the example question in class. You have to understand the material well before take the exam.

Bonsall is fantastic. He is extremely intelligent and truly passionate about Accounting. The tests are very tough but there is a very large curve in the end. Small group projects throughout the class, but all are interesting. I didn't purchase the textbook and did fine without it.

Bonsall's the man! He made the class fun and interesting. Tests were really tough but there's a massive curve at the end. He's also really reasonable about moving things around if necessary. He's incredibly intelligent, and he moves really quickly and expects you to pick things up quickly, but put in the work and you'll be fine.

I wish I could have Prof. Zhang for all my accounting classes. Her teaching style makes the subject interesting. Her discussions in class are always centered around understanding WHY we do what we do. No curve in class, but she grades everything herself and gives partial credit if she can understand your logic. Homework isn't too difficult.
Good teacher who obviously knows what she's doing. Accounting is a complicated subject in general and I feel like Prof. Zhang did an excellent job at teaching the subject.

I never opened the book & the only reason I bought was for weekly HW which r grade booster; u get 6 out 10 & u get 100% for the assignment. Quizzes r sometimes tough but for most of the time she copy pastes HW questions verbatim. She has a TA who has no mercy when grading. But a major curve at the end of the class. If u have C u'll end up with A.

Doing the homework is an easy grade booster, but the quizzes and exams are fairly straightforward. She doesn't teach the material well at all, and you basically have to learn it on your own. I would recommend taking the class with a different professor, so you grade is hopefully not on the borderline of passing or not.
Quiz grades are usually much lower than you ever thought.

This class is difficult, but she is willing to help students outside of class. Her test questions come directly from the homework problems. There are only two cases and she grades them easy. Doing the homework will help boost your grade. The tests and quizzes are hard, but if you study the notes and homework problems, you will be fine.
a good chunk of our grade (40%) was not released but I received a B. She is really nice but the class can be pretty difficult.

I struggled in this class, since I havent had an accounting class in over 2 years, but Helen was very helpful. Her quizzes and midterms ask the hw questions in different ways so know alternative to hw problems. Go to class, study hw/read book, and participate in class and you should get a B at least.

If you go to class and do all of the practice and homework you will be fine. The textbook is next to useless. Sometimes she'll rush through problems and put in the wrong numbers. This proved confusing and rocked me on the second midterm. Because the classes are so long, I would strongly recommend not missing any.

Helen is awesome. I have no idea what these other reviews are from. She's incredibly flexible with her lessons plans and is willing to re-teach things that people obviously don't understand. Quizzes and Midterms come straight from the homework problems and the homework is almost a guaranteed full points every time.
ok

Midterm is tricky and with a lot of mistakes in it. Also, after you finish her part of the quarter, she will never reply your email. Actually, she is just willing to reply emails at the beginning of the quarter. kinda nice while facetoface talking but not the real who she is.

Just finished her half of the quarter teaching during WI 11 and found her to be completely different than what the reviews say. The homeworks and quizzes were easy. Most of the homework answers are given in the practice problems. Overall enjoyed her portion of the class

She is aweful. She co-teaches with another professor, and during helens part of the class i had a D, during the second half I had an A. She is hard to understand, doesn't teach well at all. Please do yourself a favor and avoid her

Avoid her if you can. I couldnt really understand her half the time. Her quizes are hard. Midterm was brutal. the HW doesnt help you at all for the quizes........ If you read this and still take her class, you're an idiot
The online homeworks and practices have little help with her quizzes. Besides her lecture is not as clear as I was expecting.

Helen wasn't the most clear professor I've ever had, but she was definitely enthusiastic and made sure we knew the main ideas. She also told us what each of the 4 questions on the midterm would cover which was helpful. overall, if you pay attention to and understand her lectures, the midterm will be a breeze.

Seems nice, but she did not respond to a single email(of 10+) of mine all quarter. Midterm is rough, but you get a cheat sheet. She's a bit akward in class. Says there's participation grade, but never marks down neone's points. I would study the text and not go to class if I had her again. Go to class before midterm to review relevant information.
Very nice.  Midterm is hard.
not bad for an accounting professor
Her tests questions are odd.

She is a very good professor.  She moved kinda quick, but that was because there was quite a bit of material to cover.  Her system was read first then discuss in class.  Also the HMWK wasn't mandatory, but do it b/c it helps make the info more clear.  I would definetly take her again.

Helen is an amazing teacher. Her test averages were around a B and they were exactly what she told us they would be! Her quizzes are tough, but not a heavy weight on the grade. As long as you show up you get a huge participation grade that helps alot! Take her if you can!! It will be worth it!

Took him for Tax II. One of the best professors I've had. Really smart guy and you will learn a lot without much work. No homework or exams. Just in class open book assignments. He makes tax interesting and doesn't add any busy work. I'd recommend the class to anyone. Need to buy the book.

Took him for Tax II, III, tax research, and tax case studies.  Awesome professor.  He is a tax guru, and I've learned a lot about tax from him and how to apply it in the real world.  Once you figure out what he's looking for, the quizzes/assignments are pretty easy.

Excellent professor. I took him for Tax II, Tax III, and Tax research. Doesn't want you to have a lot of outside homework, but you do need to read the book. Take his classes even if you aren't going into tax! He's very easy going and genuinely nice.
He is awesome

If it weren't for this teacher I'd imagine AMIS majors would drop to approx. 10% of what it is now.  This teacher is an angel of mercy in a dept. where every other AMIS teacher seems to have serious mental baggage by comparison.  This guy doesn't "have" to prove anything, & it shows in his fantastic teaching style. Take Tax I & II w/ him - period!
Easy, only homeworks and in  class quizzes.  No exams at all.
Be sure to take his Tax I & II class.  No exams, just assignments!!!
I can not say enough good things about this professor.  He is very friendly and helpful.  I very highly recommend people to take any class this professor teaches.

I think the problem with this class is that "research" itself is very practical, and your research skills can only improve through experiences and time. This course should actually be made as a speech type or something. Prof. Turner might be a little boring at times but he's extremely nice and helpful. :)
must avoid this guy!!!! trust me everyone should avoid!
I guess he was a better partner than he is an instructor. The worst class I have ever had.
Great Proffesor. Was in a partner in the industry and knows a lot about accounting.  One of the Best Professors in that I had.

Great teacher, but not easy at all.  He tells you exactly what to study for on the exams but they are still pretty difficult.  Every MC problem has to be looked at in extreme detail.  Although, you will learn audit beyond basic memorization and I did appreciate that.  I'd take him again if it was the only class I was taking that quarter lol
If you have to take him then you have no choice.  But if you can schedule the class for a different semester with another professor you have to do it.  Make sure you avoid taking him at all costs.

The worst class I took in Business School was his International Accounting class.  Extremely boring, grades the case studies way to harshly.  Probably the most boring class I have taken in college.  Takes role everyday for %10 of your grade.  His tests are ridiculous in that your have to memorize everything from his lectures.

A lot different than other accounting classes I've taken, which was a nice change.  He basically goes over the powerpoints that go along with the book and elaborates on them.  Tests are fairly easy, although his multiple choice questions can be tricky.  Overall though a much easier accounting class.

Reads directly from notes that are made by the book.  Tests and quizes are difficult because you have to memorize little details.  No actually auditing is done in the class.  Only thing good about Pat is that he is enthusiastic, however extremely boring.

Okay Pat is VERY BORING.  Class is ALL ppt slides and he just reads them to you.  The class will teach you to memorize terms no actual auditing here just memorize concepts.  If I could go back in time, I would definately pass up this course.
No Comments
No Comments

Writing for someone who is not going to understand what I wrote, but here it is: The class is almost a crash course to Auditing, he covers one chapter a day, its impossible to keep up with reading and specially remember some of the details he asks in exam. Exams have some subjective parts, and he is not an easy grader. Like auditing but not class.
The class isn't bad...the tests are somewhat difficult, it's an easy B.

Incredible teacher and fascinating class. I have honestly never learned so much in such a short amount of time. That said, it was the most challenging course I have ever taken. He curves well but by no means will you get a good grade just for putting in work. Be up for a challenge and you will love this class. Would take another of his if I could.
Tzachi is the best professor I've had at OSU. The class was hard, but Tzachi made it worth taking. He is prepared, engaging, and funny. I would love to take another one of his classes.
He is an awesome professor, who actually cares about his students learning the material. Very clear, but definitely need to work. It's an Honors class and is curved to a B+.
Mr. Zach cares about his students.  He has well put together lecture notes.  This class also moves at a fast pace, but is very manageable.  He also has a sense of humor.

Larry is a really nice guy who  genuinely cares about his students, but his lectures are very, very boring.  There's three exams, and all three are very different in regards to how it compares to the homework questions and lecture slides, which makes it hard to study.
Great professor! Larry does a wonderful job explaining the material and nailing the important points home. Exams were pretty easy as long as you studied. Larry is such a nice guy!

LT is a nice guy, just not that great of a professor. You probably won't learn much from his lectures, which tend to break off on long tangents unrelated to the material. Exams are tricky but not bad at all.

Terrible professor. Attended every lecture and barely learned anything. Quizzes are impossible because he references minute library principles without any warning. Easily worst professor because he acts like he cares and is a great teacher but gives the most unhelpful lectures ive ever been to and ive been to quite a few. is a very nice guy though

Larry's a super nice guy, but his lectures are admittedly kinda boring. Protip: sit in a place where he can't see you nodding off. The class itself isn't bad -- the first midterm was definitely the hardest, but the successive two were pretty easy. Case write-up for final. Not bad at all.
His lecture is a pain in the butt. He is a nice guy but doesn't teach anything.
less and less ppl coming to the class, HW and quiz are not based on the course material. The same voice/tone through out the course. But really good PPT and a nice guy.

So boring, lectures are painful. Won't give you much help for upcoming exams. Instead of helping on a problem he told my group "I cannot help you, it defeats the purpose of assigning homework"... He rambles... not about anything exciting, accounting stuff, slow talker. Did I say painful?
Great guy, bad prof. Lectures are painfully boring. Expect to teach yourself the material out of the book; lecture notes don't cover the test material.

Coach was truly passionate about financial reporting. He is very easy going and I looked forward to attending each class, which usually involved stimulating discussion. I liked the amount of presentations throughout the class, and thought that overall the exams were not difficult. In short a beneficial class that yielded much learning.

nice guy, but I would avoid taking him.  I think the other profs that teach this course do a better job of preparing students for the exams.  He gives you a lot of pretty useless info that will not be tested on.

coach was a cool dude. tests were challenging but fair. helpful if you ever needed him outside of class. kinda boring in lecture, but dry sense of humor keeps it interesting. you are to do the work & probs outside of class bc in class he lectures bout real life applications which i found very cool interesting. good guy id recommend him if ur smart

Despite what many say I actually enjoyed this guy. Lectures were dry from time to time but as an accounting major I found the course interesting. A lot of work but prepare well for the exams and there are few surprises. The guy is very dedicated and willing to help if you give him a chance. Highly recommend him! You will learn a lot!

Class was completely online, more or less the only thing he did for me was pass out the test and grade them. He used everything from the book and it was simple... don't feel like I actually learned anything

The material is easy but he makes it much harder than it needs to be.  He had to curve the final exam by around 20 points and he had to curve the final grades as well.  Nice guy, bad teacher, I should have taken Ziegler.

wow, I got my first C+ in this class! I am a senior and never got anything below B in my entire college life before taking this class. His exams are really hard even though he doesn't teach anything in the class. I highly recommend not to take this class with him since it will lower your GPA.
He is a nice guy, but damn tough.  I worked pretty hard just to get a B-.  He is definitely harder than the other 521 prof.
I have to take this class again and will do everything in my power never to get him again.
He is the worse accounting professor I have ever had!  His lectures are incomprehensible and I don't get anything out of it.

Great guy, lousy professor. I wouldn't recommend him if you're taking a full course load. He gives you an ungodly amount of out-of-class work. My grades in other classes suffered because I had to devote so much time to this class. The lectures are pretty much useless.

Prof T is a very nice man, and always willing to help, but I cant understand why Fisher is paying him to teach? I had to teach myself everything I learned in this class. He expects that you read the chapter, all the power points, and do the online excersises before you come to class. He does an irrelevant case problem in class. Choose a diff Prof!

Kinda boring but easier than some of the other accounting professors. He is very willing to help you and will answer email quickly. It was nice to have a take-home final but study hard for the second midterm.

This man is one of the most monotonous, unexciting, dull men I have ever had as a prof. He has good intentions but he is a wretched professor.  His lectures are worthless. Don't bother attending. I learned everything from reading the textbook and from the TA. If you can avoid him, do.
I still don't like accounting but he was helpful when you asked for help.

Took the online course.  Very easy, just do the quizes each week and go to the tutor room and get an easy B.  The tutors were very helpful and the question and answers on fridays were very helpful.  Definetly take this class if available.
Very Very good guy to have for Accounting. Do the work, goto the reviews and he'll help you get an A. Highly recommend him.
Excellent online course!!! Easy A!  Just do the assigned work every week and you will get an A in the class!
How can students sleep in an Honors class while the Director of the program is teaching...!  Very NICE person...unfortunately didnt like him as instructor!

I took the class online and found it interesting.  The first 4 weeks were kind of tough.  But once you got the hang of the basics I thought the class was a breeze.  Do make sure you check your HW and quizzes for any grading errors so you can get all the points you earned.

I took his class online, which had it's advantages and disadvantages: didn't have to walk to class, but that meant we were entirely on our own to learn the material.  He had review sessions, but they werent much help and never covered what we did in the homeworks or quizzes.  Exams are impossible.
didnt like him, he doesnt teach much of what is on his exams, seems to babble on forever about things that dont matter
Nice guy, but HARD exams!!
is helpful but doesn't teach the exam material in class
One of the most caring and nicest teachers I have had at OSU.  Very hard tests, but he'll help you as much you need to get you to have a good grade in the class.
Class was REALLY boring, but he's a nice guy. Exams are crunch time, but not much work out of class besides that.
The class was very difficuly but I expected that being an honors level accounting class. Very nice guy but can be a little boring at times.
AWFUL!  He goes over every single class, and does not teach anything that is on the tests.  Try very hard to avoid this teacher!

VERY VERY boring, I went to about 50% of the classes, most of the class never showed up, and when I did go, 50% of the class was sleeping, he doesn't do anything but stand there and babble. Practice exams are a must to review! Learned absolutely nothing!
Terrible professor! He can not teach and I am disgusted that he is at OSU.  However, he does give out his sample midterms.  Study this and only this! They are very similar to the midterms he gives.

There needs to be more Marc Smiths at OSU: challenging but great/thorough. There are far too many egotistical profs and Murdock is no exception. Avgs hover around 50% and I could care less what the curve is, if you have to curve that much, you're failing as a teacher. OSU needs to do right and rid Fisher of professors like Murdock.

Awful! Usually I feel like these comments on here are just exaggerated by students who don't try, but not this time! I have a 3.92 GPA and will be happy with a C or D (and that's only b/c he curves).  Midterm average=50%.  Haven't got the final grade yet, but honestly did not feel sure about 1 single question! I am not exaggerating,DO NOT TAKE HIM!
Horrible horrible professor, learned nothing and GPA sharply fell down, will talk A and write B, never really cared students feelings. Avoid at all cost

He is knowledgeable and does know whats best for the CPA exam. However, I think that at this point its best to get down the concepts BEFORE learning the CPA, which he does not do. Be prepared to teach yourself how to do the problems and know the material, because his lectures are BORING and hard to follow. Very tough to get a good grade.
My favorite accounting professor yet. I felt like by him relating concepts to the CPA and the real world I could see the bigger picture of what we were learning.

Absolutely awful.  Wastes class time rambling on about the CPA exam and how no one will pass it, never does sample problems or anything to help you learn the material.  I was bored to tears in every class.  He curves a lot but it's still impossible to get a good grade(exam averages were around 55%).  Avoid if you can!!
WORST TEACHER EVER! i learned absolutely nothing
People need to grow up.  It is a challenging course, but it's not impossible.  He doesn't hold your hand like some other professors.  Take his class and you may actually learn something.

Impossible. I cried everyday in that class. He expects everything from you, but will teach you NOTHING. do NOT take him, but the irronic part is, he is the only person that teaches 523. All he does is talk about the CPA exam, and how we will fail. You must come to class or you loose 25 points, but the class is pointless.

He still strikes a nerve five years post grad.  His class was the reason I did not have a 4.0 in my major.  His ego and rambling about the CPA exam make class worthless.  He's not a CPA.  His tests were taken from the publisher.  As far as the CPA exam, it's challenging because there is such a huge pool from which to pick questions.  It's doable.

I had him for 3 weeks, and he is terrible. 523 students TAKE MARC SMITH IF YOU CAN IN THE SUMMER!! It's worth planning out so that you take marc smith's 523 in the summer. Marc is the BEST ACCT PROFESSOR in fisher hands down. I actually learned soo much in his class and got an A. Seriously think about what I am saying if you are an acct major.
TAKE THIS CLASS, you will find what is Acctant future....

This prof has been a bad memory even 15 yrs. after graduation.I grad Summa so I was no idiot.He was unable to communicate his subject matter and substituted arrogance for teaching ability.As an 35y/o,not used to dealing with such lack of professionalism,I dropped, aced it with another prof and just to prove him wrong-passed the CPA exam 1st try.

I want to start by saying that before this class I actually enjoyed accounting classes.  Having said that, Murdock is the WORST professor that I've had at OSU. He made up ridiculous rules like, if you have to miss class for any reason you get minus 25 points for attendance. Also, the tests are made up of cpa questions & are all or nothing.

I had heard bad things about this class, and it was as bad as everyone said it was.  Going to class is virtually useless because of his long tangents about the CPA exam.  Exams are extremely difficult.  Many of the questions are not like anything we did in class and many are taken right from the CPA exam.  It's a shame he still teaches at Fisher.

He is by far the worst professor I've had at Fisher.  His lectures always went over the alloted time, but over half of it was worthless information.  Read the book and have a general understanding of the material.  Don't worry about the grade, he curves a lot.

His tests were extremely difficult.  The average grades were 45 and 50%.  He teaches easy problems in class and then takes questions from the CPA exam for his tests.  However, his curve was much better than I expected.

Very very difficult class, but obviously required for all Accounting majors.  Averages are usually 40-50% on tests.  Teaches class as if it were a CPA class.  Bad on responding to emails.  Must read book but even that won't get you a good grade.  Curved the class by about 25 percentage points.

Uses extremely hard exams and quizzes to prepare you for the CPA exam, but at the expense of your grade in the class, which he seems to think doesn't matter. Pretty generous curver, though. Overall, I feel like I'm being talked down to more than taught.

Uses extremely hard exams and quizzes to prepare you for the CPA exam, but at the expense of your grade in the class, which he seems to think doesn't matter. Pretty generous curver, though. Overall, I feel like I'm being talked down to more than taught.

He is so hard and not nice, spends extensive time yelling at the class, might as well be an internet class because he does not teach and expects you to know things without him teaching them. RIDICULOUS!
terrible

This is probably the hardest class in the accounting major. Murdock is frustrating and his tests are extremely difficult. For ppl who want to take CPA exam, this class will be beneficial in realizing that the test is no joke. The class is not bad as long as you beat the average.

if you can get past the sarcasm then he is a good professor to have.  he explains things clearly and thoroughly and seems to really enjoy teaching. going through the chapter before class greatly helps.

Hands down most helpful teacher in Fisher, took her last quarter (winter 11) and wish she taught every accounting class. Her exams are kind of tough but if you keep up with the material, you'll do fine! Definitely recommend!!!

There is no possible way to find a better professor for this class.  She doesn't try to trick you, just makes sure you know what you need to know. Class will seem easy if you keep up with the assigned work (even though it isn't turned in).  Exams and quizzes aren't bad if you study & do the practice problems.  Email response time is incredibly fast

Kara is a great teacher for 521, she is new to Fisher but by far one of the most helpful that I've had thus far. She's had experience in the field so she really knows what she is talking about and will provide relevant examples. Exams aren't horrible, but you need to study. Truly is interested in helping her students
She is very helpful on and off her office hours. Read her notes and text books for quiz. Do exercises over and over again. This classis an easy A. just make sure u understand what she wants.
One of the best professors I've had @ Fisher. She cares that you learn the material and teaches it with clarity and passion. I would recommend her to all accounting students.

Jennifer has real world experience in accounting which makes the class more interesting and she explains everything very clearly and is happy to answer questions. The quizzes were pretty hard, but the final exam wasn't too bad. You are allowed to bring an 8.5x11 two-sided cheat sheet to the midterm as well as the final. Overall, helpful and clear.

She tells jokes and teaches the class very well for it not being that interesting. She talks really loud, so you might want to sit a row back. She?ll go over everything in class for the exams. You only need the book for homework.

Take AMIS 522 with her! Great teacher- able to clearly articulate the subject matter, and she was always available to help (even through email questions). She genuinely cares about her students. I ended up doing very well in the class, and she reached out to congratulate me after the quarter. Seriously...what profs care enough to do that?? A+.
very nice! she even gave candy out in class!

Ms. Altamuro exemplifies the first-rate instruction techniques that radiate through Fisher. Not only is she easy on the eyes, but her heuristic teaching style evinces her natural intellect--which effortlessly disseminates to her infatuated pupils. Though, the homework is a little long.
pretty good, much better than the other professor (zhang) that she team teaches with. kind of screams when she talks but is good at explaining and exams are fair.
